loans.name: Pong

texts.en:
Pong V. is 28 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. He is married with one child who is attends public school. His wife works in a garment factory and has a monthly salary that is used to provide for the family’s needs. 

Pong V. is currently working as a soldier. He is concerned that he is hardly working and his wife dreams of having a vehicle to go to work, but he doesn’t have the money to buy one. Therefore, Pong V. is requesting a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use to commute to work. The remainder of his loan will be used to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle and for house repairs

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga S. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a small house that he built last year. His wife looks after their twins at home and the three elder sons attend a local secondary school. 

He operates a newspaper and magazine sales business at bus stop booth. Early in the morning he purchases a daily newspaper from the newspaper distribution center and sells it at his booth. His daily earnings are 30.000-40.000 MNT. He has been operating this business steadily for four years. He is requesting a loan to purchase a computer for his children.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
Maryann Mwikali is 36 years old and married with three children between three and 15. Her husband is a cattle seller. Maryann’s business is located at Kakamega town where she sells cereals to local people. Besides this business, she also sells a fish known locally as Omena. Maryann has had her business for 24 years now and is able to employ one person. Her business is profitable and her major challenge is competition, as there are many other similar businesses in the area and her customers have many choices. 

Maryann describes herself as social, outgoing, and optimistic. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more fish and cereals to expand her business. In future, she hopes to become a wholesale supplier.

loans.use: to buy fish and cereals

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en:
Lhagvadulam C. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter attends university and her three other daughters attend school. Lhagvadulam’s husband is currently unemployed although he works in the construction field during summer months. Lhagvadulam operates a meat and dairy retail business in her town. Since beginning her business in 1997 she has gained significant experience and has been able to build a stable organization. Lhagvadulam is able to pay her daughter's tuition fees. 

Lhagvadulam is a modest person. In the future, she would like to expand her business and own her own workplace but her dream is to work in any company in any occupation. Lhagvadulam is requesting a 395,000 MNT loan to purchase meat at wholesale prices to sell in her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale meat

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en: Allah Rakhi lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan famous for its dairy industry. She is 32 years old and married to M. I., who operates a business of selling bread.   Allah Rakhi  is a housewife. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law, who is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to his passengers, including school children. He will use the loan to repair his rickshaw because its engine is not working well.  Allah Rakhi is hopeful that through this investment her brother-in-law’s rickshaw will become fully repaired and allow him to work for longer hours.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Shaariibuu

texts.en:
Shaariibuu T. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children, all between six and 21, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Shaariibuu and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His two oldest children attend university while his younger two sons are in a local school. His wife works in a bakery shop and Shaariibuu operates a car repair and service as well as a livestock fodder trading businesses. 

Shaariibuu has been operating his car repair service in his yard since 1987 and has built a stable and successful operation. To supplement his earnings, he operates a livestock forage trading business throughout the countryside. Shaariibuu and his wife work hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives through education. 

Shaariibuu is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his businesses. In the future, he hopes to have his own car repair center and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag H. is a 41-year-old and lives with her husband two sons in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her oldest son is 20 years old and currently serves in the Mongolian military while her youngest son, age 16, attends a local high school, and her husband works as a driver in the mining company. The family used to live and work as herders in the countryside and moved to their current town in 1998. Tungalag started her business in 2002 by selling a variety of products that have been imported from China. Today, she focuses on expanding her business and improving the product quality that she sells. Tungalag is a talktive and open-minded woman and says," By saving my husband's salary, we would like to purchase a new apartment." She is requesting a 1,200,000-MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her consumer goods trading business.

loans.use: To buy more consumer goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay T., 35, has been working as a policeman since 2005, and has a proper salary very month. (Lay T. was not available the day of the photo, so his wife is in the photo instead.) Lay T. can earn a living by working this position for approximately of $6.50 per day. He has a life partner in his wife, who is a garment worker. The couple has three children; all of them are single and living under their roof. Currently, Lay T. wishes to open a new business selling breakfast and coffee  in front their house in order to make more income to ensure their family living is a comfortable life. But his account savings is not enough to make that possible. So, he would request a loan to open a coffee and breakfast shop for additional profit.

loans.use: To open coffee shop and selling breakfast for additional profit.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 48-year-old man living and working in Kasese, Uganda with 5 children. He sells sacks. He has been in the same business for six years. His goals and dreams are to educate his children up to university, have more outlets and become a wholesaler dealing in sacks. The purpose of the loan is to purchase sacks to sell at a margin.

loans.use: Purchasing sacks for resale

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 54-year-old lady who is married to a gentleman called Kamuya. They have four children. Though one is married, the other three fully depend on them. She has been farming for four years with an income of 1,000 (local dollars) per month.  

Telesia is taking her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loan. She intends to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. She hopes to have better returns from her farm in order to buy land to build on.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Margaret Wawira

texts.en:
Margaret is a 32-year-old rice farmer. She was married but later separated from her husband, and they have two children. Margaret has been doing rice farming for the past 11 years with a monthly income of Kshs 10,000, which she uses to support her children. 

Margaret has applied for her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying her first loan. She plans to use the money to purchase farm items such as fertilizer and food for labourers on her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, Margaret intends to pay school fees to educate her children. 

She hopes to educate her children to the highest level possible, to construct a better house for her mother and expand the rice farming business.

loans.use: To purchase farming items like fertilizer.

loans.name: Bernard Wanjohi

texts.en:
Bernard is 41 years old and married to Lucy Wambua. They have three children who wholly depend on them. Bernard has been in the farming industry for a period of 9 years with an income of 15,000 KES a month.

This is his second loan with KADET, and he wants to use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay for weeding and harvesting labour. 

He hopes educate his children and to purchase and own a rice farm, as he is currently leasing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labour for weeding and harvesting.

loans.name: Jadambaa

texts.en: Jadambaa D. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and infant son in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house that had built by himself in his yard. Jadambaa operates a wooden products production business in his town. He started his wood products business in 2006 and has since built a stable and successful operation. He has used his earnings to improve his quality of life. For the future, Jadambaa hopes to establish his own carpentry workshop and enlarge his workplace. He is a modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his wood product business.

loans.use: To buy more wood and tools for making wooden products

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She got married to A. and came to this city 12 years ago. She has given birth to 6 children. All of them are getting an education except the last one who is only 3 years of age. Kalsoom herself is a housewife and prefers to stay at home and does her household work.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to sell through his store. She is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and her family’s financial condition will be improved. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Kalim

texts.en:
Kalim is 47 years old and married to Raphael, with whom she has three children. She has been in the food retail selling business for 11 years and is getting an income of 19000 KES a month. She sells items like sugar, flour, rice, sweets, and many other items. 

Kalim is taking her first loan with KADET to buy 3 bags of sugar and flour. She hopes to have more shops in the area which will be managed by her children in future.

loans.use: purchase more bags of sugar and flour to resell

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar I. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. At first, she started her business in 2008 by selling a variety of clothes and household products with help of her sister. Since then, she has found success with her business, and she has been selling a variety of underwear and socks selling business by herself in the local market while her sister still manages their previous business. For the future, she would like to expand her business by enlarging her pavilion and increasing her product amount. Otgonbayar says, " I want to continue grow my business and buy my own plot of land with a fence in the future." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more socks and underwear to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more socks and underwear to resell in the market

loans.name: Jackline Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jackline is 30 years old and married to Samson Kariuki with whom they have two children. She has been in the mobile banking service business (M-pesa) for 4 years now with an income of 26,100 KES per month. She also sells mobile phone accessories in her shop as well. 

Jackline is taking her first loan in KADET and wants to use it to increase the cash flow for her mobile banking service shop. She hopes to expand her business and buy a plot of land to build rental houses in future and secure her family’s stable income.

loans.use: To increase the cash flow for her mobile banking service shop.

loans.name: Tursaihan

texts.en:
Tursaihan T. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia.  His two daughters both attend a local school.  His wife operates a grocery store while Tursaihan drives a taxi using his own car in their town.  

They started their grocery store business in 2007 with a small shop and since then they have expanded their shop into a bigger grocery store in 2010.  For the future, they plan to enlarge their store into a supermarket and provide a good educations for all their four daughters. Tursaihan is a talktive and open minded man and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase their working capital for their grocery shop.

loans.use: to increase their working capital for their grocery shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 32 years old and married to Patrick Mwangi. They have one child and her husband is a civil servant in Kenya.  She has been running her retail shop for one year with an income of 9,000 KES.

Esther has applied for her first loan with KADET which she wants to use to buy stocks of sugar, cooking fat and flour.  With her savings she would like to start a beauty salon as a secondary business on the side.

She hopes to see her child achieve her dreams through education and to have a good life for all of them.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, cooking fat and flour.

loans.name: Unathan

texts.en: Unathan T. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two sons both attend a local secondary school. Her husband and Unathan operate a clothing trade business in the two different local markets in their town. They sell a variety of clothing items that are imported from China. They started their business in 2000 and have since built a stable and successful operation. After many years, they were able to buy a small plot of land where they built a house. Next year, they plan to improve their car and fix the ceiling of their house. Unathan is a clever and hard-working woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothes from China in order to increase their volume.

loans.use: To import more clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is 64 years old and married to Joseph. She supports her mother-in-law and her husband does farming on their family land. Mary raises rabbits and sells them at a profit, which has been her business for two years and brings her an income of 4,000 KES a month.

This is Mary's first loan with KADET and she intends to buy building materials to expand the rabbit pen. She hopes to start rearing broilers in the near future.

loans.use: To buy building materials to extend the rabbit pen.

loans.name: Ashra's Group

texts.en: Ashra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s construction supply business. With the loan he will buy cement, bricks, etc in bulk that will help him to fill larger orders on time. Ashra hopes that her husband’s business will improve with this loan, which will result in improving her family’s lifestyle. Ashra got married 12 years ago and became the mother of two sons. Her financial condition is not good enough to send her children to school yet, but she hopes that her husband’s improved business condition will enable her to send them to school in the near future. Ashra lives with her family in Mianchannu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and pays her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a construction supply business

loans.name: Esther Silantoi

texts.en:
Esther Silantoi K. is 26-years-old.  She is married to Tinga Mulas and she is the mother of five school-aged children.  Esther is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last two years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered member in KADET.  This will be her second loan which she is planning to spend thirty thousand shillings to prepare her piece of land and the other thirty to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season.  She hopes to use the profits from this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Esther’s dream is do large scale farming and attain financial independence.  She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare her piece of land and purchase seedlings and fertilizers for the next planting season.

loans.name: Amy Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Amy  Diagne Cissé est âgée de 46 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce de légumes, poissons fumés et sel depuis1997.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis décembre  2009. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000frs prévu pour l’achat de s produits qu’elle commercialise en vue de renforcer son stock .Le crédit lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et de  mieux prendre en charge les dépenses au sein de la famille.
texts.en: Madame Amy Diagne Cissé is 46 years old. She lives in Bambilor.  She is married and has been active in the business of selling vegetables, fish, and salt since 1997.  She has been a member of the Bambilor credit union since December of 2009.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs to purchase more of  the products she sells so that she can build up her stock.  The loan will allow her to increase her revenue and to better meet family expenses.

loans.use: to increase capital

loans.name: Antony Kamau

texts.en:
AntonyN. is 36 years-old and married to Anjerica Wanjiku.  He is the father of two children ages two and eight years old.  Antony works in a furniture shop as a carpenter and he has been in this type of business for the last three years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy lumber and carpentry equipment and the other ten thousand to buy and replace his work tools.  With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to reinvest in other businesses and do farming.

His dream is to become the best carpenter in town and be able to provide for all of his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase lumber, tools and equipment for his furniture and carpentry business.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab lives in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan. She came here after her marriage 12 years ago. Since then, she has lived in a two-room brick house with her family.
 
She is 39 years old and married to M. S., who is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He sells vegetables in different streets of the city by putting them on a four-wheeled cart. He has been doing this business for over eight years, and people prefer buying from him due to his good behavior and the freshness of his vegetables.
 
Zainab herself is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of household responsibilities. She takes her responsibilities very seriously and tries to give comfort to her family with her efforts. She has two sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate. Both her sons do labor for daily wages.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some fresh seasonal vegetables to sell. Zainab hopes that after this investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position, making him more income than before.
 
She is one of Asasah's regular loan users, and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she built a good credit record and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for the vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Olonyikie Ole

texts.en:
Olonyikie Ole M. is 52-years-old and he is married to Noolarami M..  He is the father of fourteen children who are between the ages of one and half and 22 years old.  M. is a farmer and he has been in this business for the last fourteen years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his fourth loan which he is planning to use to plant more tomatoes which normally do well in his area due to the good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his production.

His future dreams are to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more tomatoes for commercial purposes. His would like to be a large scale farmer.  He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To plant more tomatoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is married with seven children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to have a healthy family and a good standard of living for his family. He has been operating a bar business for the last ten years which he started on a small scale by selling local brew to get where he is now. He hopes to expand since he hasn’t had any challenges yet, and that is why he intends to use the loan funds to buy beer to sell at his pub.

loans.use: Buying beer to sell at his pub

loans.name: Safia Muhammad Farooq's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She has a daughter who is just 5 years old. She is a very supportive lady and always ready to help her family at difficult times. She is married to M. F. who has a business selling fruit. He operates his business on a four-wheeled cart. He puts the fruit on it every day and visits different streets of the city to sell his fruit. 
  
Many varieties of fruit are coming into season as the weather changes and that’s why Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. The loan amount will help him to buy the seasonal fruits in bulk quantity to sell to his customers. Safia is hopeful that through this investment, her husband’s business will improve and he will be able to get maximum profit on his sales.  

Safia is a resident of Mianchannu, which is a small city in Pakistan. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur ibrahima S. est un jeune commerçant qui vend des articles de mercerie dans un petit marché de la place a quartier de grand mbour. Il a une expérience de prés de 3 ans dans son secteur d'activité. Ainsi, monsieur S. est venu solliciter ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités en cette période de fête pour avoir son gagne pain
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima S. is a young merchant who sells sewing notions at a small marketplace in the neighborhood of Grand Mbour. He has almost three years experience in this activity. 

Mr. S. is seeking a loan to strengthen his business and earn a living in this time of celebration.

loans.use: Trade

loans.name: Pariken Ole

texts.en:
Pariken Ole M. is 44 years old, married and a father of eight children. Pariken is a farmer who has been in this business for the last eleven years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is going to use to plant four acres of wheat in the current planting season. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demands for wheat in the area.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a young and energetic man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: Planting wheat

loans.name: Isaac Issah

texts.en:
Isaac is a 29-year-old single gentleman who is in the business of buying cereals and transporting them to different centers where he sells the cereals at a profit. He has been in the business for five years now and he says he makes good profits out of it. He also runs a mobile accessories shop in town as a secondary business.

He learned about KADET Ltd through an existing client. Isaac has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase more cereals like maize and beans for resale.

His future plan is to expand his business and even employ people who will assist him in the business, increasing efficiency and hence, profits.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old, married to Susan and he supports three members of his family. He is doing mixed farming (animal and farm) and this has been his business for a period of 4 years with an income of 14,000 KES a month.

He has never been a member of an MFI and this is his first loan with KADET.  He intends to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and manure and animal feeds such as maize jam, dairy meal and deworming medication for the animals.

He hopes to expand his business and become a leading local farmer and own a milk processing plant.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Madame Fama T. est une femme mariée de 43 ans.  Elle habite à Bambilor. Madame T. a choisi l’activité de commerce a cause de son aspect lucratif pour la satisfaction de ses besoins. Ainsi elle évolue depuis 2005 dans l’achat et la vente de produits de beauté, de tissus et divers autres. En même temps elle  pratique l’élevage de poussins. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis juin 2010. Elle emprunte 300000frs qui sera destiné à l’achat de 500 poussins. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter ses sujets, d’améliorer la rentabilité de son activité et par conséquent de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. Fama T. is a married and 43 years old. She lives in Bambilor. Mrs. T. has decided to be a merchant motivated by the financial aspect and the need to cover her expenses. And thus since 2005 she has been active in selling cosmetic products, fabrics, and various other items. In addition, she also raises chickens. She joined the Bambilor fund in June 2010. She is borrowing 300,000 Francs, which will be used to purchase 500 chicks. This loan will allow her to increase her livestock, to improve the profitability of her business, and, as a result, to increase her savings.

loans.use: Purchasing chicks

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité de mujeres Nueva Esperanza se conformo en octubre del 2007, y ya han pasado diversas situaciones, que han podido superar y tomas como experiencia para crecer como comité y como personas. 

Las señoras son   Bella Vista, y los créditos que solicitan son  para la compra de mercaderías e insumos las actividades a que de dedican cada una de las integrantes.

Ellas comentan que están contentas con el crédito recibido ya que les ayuda en sus emprendimientos, teniendo en cuenta que la zona donde viven hay bastante movimiento comercial y necesitan de capital de trabajo para impulsar sus labores a fin de cumplir con sus clientes y proveerles de productos y servicios.

Renuevan por 11 vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, donde la directora general.
 Mita A., se dedica a la agricultura y cría de pollos en su residencia, con la colaboración de su marido, quien la ayuda para realizar la venta de sus productos en la zona. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su huerta.

Ella las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus cuotas para seguir con la línea de crédito.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) women's committee was formed in October 2007.  Its members have been through a number of difficult situations which they have managed to overcome and use as experience in order to grow as a committee and as people.

The loans which they are requesting are to buy merchandise and supplies for the business activities which each one of the members engages in.

They comment that they are happy with the loan they have received since it helps them in their undertakings, bearing in mind that there is quite a lot of business in their district and they need working capital to stimulate their businesses so that they can serve their customers and provide them with products and services.

They are renewing their loan for the 11th time, moving on to their next cycle because they made their previous repayments promptly.  The group's managing director Mirta A. farms and raises chickens from her home together with her husband who helps her to sell her products in the district.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her orchard.

Mirta motivates the members of her group to be punctual and make their repayments on time so that they can continue their line of credit.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her orchard

loans.name: Kantai Ole

texts.en:
Kantai Ole K. is 46-years-old, married to Naisuaku Ene K. and he is the father of four school aged children who all attend school. Kantai is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last four years.

Kantai learned about KADET from a friend who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his fourth loan which he is planning to use to buy fertilizers and some chemicals for his farming.  With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

Kantai’s future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land so he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set of goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizares.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a resident of Lahore which is Pakistan’s second largest city, known for its culture. Its history is thousands of years old and it attracts many visitors every year. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area called Khokar Road where she moved many years ago with her family. She is a housewife and spends her time at home and doing her household responsibilities.  

Her husband is a butcher by trade. Naseem’s home is situated in the street near the market and her husband has opened his shop on the corner. He sells chicken meat to his customers. He has been doing this business for many years and people prefer buying meat from his shop due to its freshness and good weight. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He will utilize the loan money in buying chickens in bulk to offer better quality fresh meat to his clients. Naseem is hopeful that after this loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and his income will double.

loans.use: To buy chickens in bulk to sell as meat

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. C. is a man of 30 years, married to Margaret K., and together they have two children. His wife is a housewife and fully depends on her husband to provide them with basic items like food, clothing, etc. David’s primary business is horticulture; he plants vegetables for resale and he also buys cereals like maize and beans in bulk and sells them in small quantities to others at a profit. He has been in this business for 16 years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya Shillings. 

This will be David's third loan through KADET, and he plans to buy more cereals for resale and also expand his farm where he plants vegetables for resale. 

In future David plans to build a good house for his family and also pay school fees for his children so that they can get the best education.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale and expand the farm for horticulture

loans.name: John Njung'e

texts.en:
John is married to Pauline and a father of two children aged 24 and 26 years. He has been doing dairy farming for over 20 years and that has been his primary business. They live in Rironi center near Limuru town, and the area is known to be relatively busy in terms of business and agricultural activities.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member and this will be his second loan with KADET. He has not borrowed from other financial institution before. With this loan he plans to buy another dairy cow for more milk production. 

He hopes and desires to give his family a good life and better education.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio Mesa Martinez tiene 43 años de edad  Esta casado con Maria Dominguez vive en Trinidad Paso Guembe. 
Tiene un puesto de venta de frutas en una de las plaza  de Encarnación. Su señora  tiene un local comercial donde vende articulos varios.  
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su micro- Empresa. 
El Destino del crédito fue para realizar compras de mas frutas como, naranjas, peras, manzanas, y otros, para su venta de fin de año. 


.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio Mesa Martinez is 43 years old. He is married to Maria Dominguez and lives in Trinidad Paso Guembe.
He runs a fruit stand in one of the squares in Encarnación. His wife has a local shop where she sells various items.
He is a very hard worker and thanks to his accomplishments he has been able to move forward and expand his micro-business.
The loan will be used to purchase more fruit such as oranges, pears, apples, and others for sale at year-end.

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables such as apples, pears, pineapples, oranges.

loans.name: Ndack

texts.fr: Madame Ndack S. est une commerçante qui vie a quartier de Grand Mbour et qui a une grande expérience dans ce domaine. Elle importe ses tissus et drap au niveau de la Mauritanie et quelques fois en Gambie. Elle vend à crédit et souvent sous commande de sa clientèle résident également à Mbour.Ndack a sillicié ce prêt pour renforcer son activité en cette période de fête où certains tissus sont prisés
texts.en: Mrs. Ndack S. is a merchant who lives in the Grand Mbour district and has a lot of experience in her business. She imports her fabrics and linens from Mauritanie and sometimes from Gambie. She sells on credit and often on order to customers also residing in Mbour. She is seeking a loan to strengthen her business during this holiday season, when certain types of fabrics are especially prized.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Isaac Wamai

texts.en:
Isaac Wamai is 36 years old and married to Irene Wangui. They have 3 children and his wife helps in selling at their retail shop where they sell things like detergents, sweets, cooking fat and bread. He has been in the retail shop business for 9 years and with an income of 16,000 KES a month.

He is taking his first loan with KADET to buy 15 bags of maize from farmers to grind into flour and later resell as flour and this will be his secondary business. 

In future he hopes to settle on his own farm and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: purchase of 15 bags of  maize

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca O. de Rodríguez tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Salustiano Rodríguez, tienen hijos pequeños que dependen aun económicamente de ellos. Viven en su propia casa situada en Barrio Santa Miguel Cambyreta.

La señora Blanca y el señor Salustiano poseen en su domicilio una amplia despensa desde hace bastante tiempo, la misma es atendida contantemente por uno de ellos. Además de esta actividad la señora Blanca es docente y se dedica a la enseñanza particular desde su casa. Gracias a esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar y solventar todos los gastos e imprevistos que se les presente.

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para la temporada de fin de año, especialmente bebidas como vinos, sidras, gaseosa, y otras como carne, frutas, verduras, azúcar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca O. de Rodriguez is 36 years old, and has been married for some time to Mr. Salustiano Rodriguez. They have young children who are still economically dependent on them. They live in their own house in Barrio Santa Miguel Cambyreta.

Blanca and Salustiano have been operating a grocery store in their home for quite some time, and one of them is always in attendance. In addition to this activity, Blanca is a teacher and gives private tutoring at her home. Thanks to these activities they can maintain their home and handle all expenses and contingencies that may occur.

They have requested this loan to buy more merchandise for the year-end season, especially beverages such as wine, cider, soft drinks, and others such as meat, fruit, vegetables and sugar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as wine, cider, soft drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat, pasta, sugar and others.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame   Amy D. habite a Bambilor. Elle est âgée  de 54 ans.  Elle est veuve et évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle pratique l’achat et la vente de poissons et de légumes. Les revenus qu’elles se procurent lui servent à soutenir ses enfants. Elle est sociétaire au guichet de Bambilor depuis juillet 2010 et sollicite un financement de 100000frs en vue  d’accroitre son fond de commerce pour mieux développer son activité de vente de poissons. L’accroissement de ses revenus lui permet de mieux prendre en charge le petit déjeuner et le diner de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy D. lives in Bambilor. She is a 54-year-old widow, and she has been working in sales for more than ten years. She does business buying and selling fish and vegetables, and the income she earns is used to support her children.

Mrs. D. has been a member of the Bambilor branch of the UIMCEC since July 2010. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs in order to increase her working capital to grow her business selling fish. The increase in income will allow her to better meet her family's breakfast and dinner expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Fatou D. est une célibataire qui exerce du commerce de vêtements, de tissus et de la prfumerie au niveau de Mbour.Elle achéte ses produits à Dakar ou en Gambie pour les replacer chez certains de ses clients. Elle est dans ce metier depuis 3 ans; ainsi,elle est venue solliciter ce crédit pour renforcer et accroitre son commerce qui lui permet également de faire face à ses besoins personnels
texts.en: Ms. Fatou D. is a single woman who runs a business selling clothing, fabrics and perfume at Mbour. She buys her goods in Dakar or Gambia to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years. Thus, she has requested this loan to bolster and increase her business.  It will also enable her to provide for her personal needs

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N., 34, charges used batteries as his primary business. He also has rental houses which he rents out to tenants within the area. He is married to Lucy Ngugi and together they have two children named Elvis (in class seven) and Zain, aged six months. Joseph has been running this battery charging business which is in Rongai for 10 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. His business is strategically placed so Joseph has many customers.

Joseph was introduced to KADET Ltd by existing clients and he has applied for a loan which he will use to open a food shop near his battery charging business as a secondary business. He plans to use the loan to buy a cook stove for this purpose. If the loan boosts the business, he will build more houses to get more income. 

Joseph describes himself as hard-working, and he has high hopes of having many rental houses. This will enable him to cater for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a cook stove and open a food shop

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom comes from Mianchannu which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a single-room brick house with her family in the area called Shamspura. She moved here 12 years ago. She is a housewife and stays at home to do her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother who is raising her son very well. Her son is 6 years old and has not started getting an education yet. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and involved in rice selling. He has a shop in the market and offers his customers different qualities of rice. He imports rice from a city  called Kamokay which is famous for its rice growing. He has been doing this business for over 6 years and getting good income from it every month. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more rice to sell in his shop. She is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband will successfully be able to increase his monthly income by increasing his sales. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Fredrick Kiptanui

texts.en:
Fredrick is 62 years old and married to Mrs. B.. They have been blessed with two children who have finished school and are engaged in different businesses. Fredrick has been in the transportation business using donkeys for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET through an existing client and with this first loan he plans to purchase an additional donkey which will enable him to serve his customers well with transportation from one place to another.

His future plan is to continue saving to enable him to take out a bigger loan to buy a motorbike for taxi services.

loans.use: To purchase an additional donkey

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 35 years old and married with four children. He has been in business for fourteen years. He sells charcoal in a busy middle-class residential area. He employs two people in his business and has been a Faulu client for a long time. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 80,000 to add to his stock of charcoal. Nicholas also owns a telephone bureau shop where he stocks telephone accessories, He also has a little restaurant. 

Nicholas wakes up at 4am to distribute charcoal to his customers; he is determined and persevering. He hopes to build his own business premises and a home for his family so as to stop renting. Faulu has taught Nicholas diversification and business management.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 21 years old and married. She has been in business for four years, operating a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes. She also operates a butcher shop. Her business is in a good location beside the road, thus ensuring a good market. Her main customers are low- and middle-income earners and she employs one person. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 70,000 to add to her stock of meat, and of clothes and shoes. She is hardworking and passionate about her business. 

Doreen hopes to be a clothes and shoe supplier in future with a five-year plan of opening more outlets in Nairobi. Since joining Faulu, her business has grown through the loans she has been receiving. She started with a boutique but has used the loans to start a butcher shop as well.

loans.use: To add  to her stock of meat, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan lives in a 2-room brick house with her family in an area called Shamsabad, which is a housing colony in Mian Channu. Mian Channu is a small city of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. 

Bashiraan is a widow and lives with her two sons. After the death of her husband, her sons left their education as they had to work to financially support the family. Her elder son sells fish while her younger son paints houses and buildings on contract. 

Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her elder son in his business. With the loan, he will buy fish of different kinds to sell. He started this business two years ago and Bashiraan is hopeful that her son will be able to increase his sales by having a good quantity of fish in stock. 

Bashiran wants to have him get married because he is 25 years old. She is hopeful that she will be able to do it very soon with the help of increased profits due to the loan. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She is a responsible client and always paid her installments on time in previous loan years.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del barrio Santa Librada  surgió por promoción  realizada en la zona. 
Todas las integrantes se encuentran trabajando y también realizando actividades que puedan generarles ingresos y de esa manera ayudar a sus familias.
Las mujeres de este comité son muy trabajadoras y se sienten muy contentas de formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Evelín quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles y de esa manera obtiene su ingreso diaria. 
Ella todos los días elabora sus comestibles especialmente empanadas que es lo que más se consume y por lo tanto es fácil de vender, también hace sopa y otros. 
Comenta que obtiene buena ganancia, y que desea seguir trabajando, solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne, harina, aceite, verduras, y otros. 
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser: venta de comidas, venta de mercaderías comestibles, venta de frutas y verduras, Copetín,  venta de ropas, puesto de ventas  de pollos.
texts.en:
This group from the Santa Libraria neighborhood got together following promotional activities conducted in the area. All members work and also carry out revenue-generating activities to help their families. The women in this committee are hard workers and are very happy to be part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs program.

One of the members is Mrs. Evelin. She sells food preparations, which provides her with a daily income. Every day she prepares her food products, especially empanadas, which are what is most consumed and therefore easy to sell. She also makes soup and other preparations.

She comments that her income is good and that she wishes to continue working. She is seeking a loan so she can purchase meat, flour, oil, vegetables, and other items..

All of the women are engaged in productive activities such as : point-of-sale for chickens, fast food stands (copetín), and the sales of food, edible goods, fruit and vegetables, or clothing.

loans.use: Buy meat, flour, oil, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine J. S. is a twenty-six-year-old woman, married and the mother of six children. She lives in Kapsoya in Eldoret town where she does her business of buying poultry such as chickens wholesale and selling them in smaller numbers. Josephine has been in this business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 5,000 shillings.


This will be Josephine's first loan with KADET and she plans to buy more poultry to add her stock. With the profits she is going to get, she plans to expand her business and even have a bigger pen where she can put her poultry.


In future, Josephine plans to buy a plot and build rental houses so that she can increase her monthly income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 41 years old and in business. She sells firewood in a slum and employs four people. Her business is located strategically near a bus stop along a busy path. She is a member of Unity SHG that has guaranteed her a loan of Kes. 60,000. 

With the loan money, Ruth intends to add to her stock of firewood for sale. Ruth is a single mother of one adult. She hopes to open another stall for selling firewood and paraffin in five years' time and employ many youths in future. She describes herself as hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To add to her stock of firewood

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa D. est une femme mariée de 36 ans. Elle vit dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de poussins et la vente d’œufs frais. Elle a une expérience  de 3 ans dans son activité. Elle a adhéré  au guichet de Bambilor  depuis novembre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle emprunte 300000fr pour acheter 150 poussins. En développant son activité madame D.  souhaite accroitre ses revenus pour pouvoir soutenir son mari surtout pendant les moments difficiles dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la prise en charge entière des besoins vitaux de  leurs enfants.
texts.en: Madame Awa D. is a married 36 year-old who lives in the Bambilor quarter. She is involved in raising poussins and selling fresh eggs; she has worked in this field for the past 3 years.  She had been a member of the Bambilor microloan association since November 2009 and has already repaid two loans to the association.  She has borrowed 300,000 FR in order to purchase 150 poussins. She wishes to boost her business in order to generate higher revenues so that she can support her husband, particularly in meeting everyday costs and looking after her children's needs.

loans.use: purchasing poussins (small chickens)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco  tiene 54 años de edad, es separado, vive con su familia en la ciudad de Trinidad y se dedica al negocio de ventas de ropas, bijouteri, toallas, sabanas, vendedor ambulante cuenta con 25 años de antigüedad en rubro lo que le permite contar con muy bueno ingresos.
El Sr. Francisco  solicita un crédito en la fundación paraguaya para cargar su negocio con más mercaderías ya que las ventas han aumentado considerablemente y  no cuenta con cantidad suficiente para  satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Ya que se está aproximando las fiestas de fin de año y las ventas aumentan bastante.
texts.en:
Francisco is 54 years old. He is separated and llives with his family in the city of  Trinidad. He works in the business of selling clothing, costume jewelry, towels, and sheets as a street vendor. He has 25 years of experience in this area and it allows him to have very good income.   

Francisco is asking for a loan from the Paraguaya foundation to provide his business with more merchandise, since his sales have increased considerably and he doesn't have enough to satisfy his customers' demand.  The end of the year festivities are approaching and his sales will go up a lot.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, clothing, costume jewelry, towels, and more.

loans.name: Absa Abass

texts.fr: Madame Absa Abass T. est une couturière qui confectionne des boubous, des habillements pour homme et femme destinés àn la revente. Elle est dans ce metier depuis quelques temps et sollicite ce crédit pour l'acquisition d'une nouvelle machine à coudre qui va lui permettre d'avoir une capacité à produire un maximum de commande et de générer des bénéfices
texts.en: Madame Absa Abass T. is a seamstress who makes boubous, wholesale clothes for men and women.  She has been involved in this field for a while and is seeking a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine which will boost her output and enable her to generate higher profits.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing machines

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkana Cheruitot is a man of 24 years, married to Charity Chepchirchir. Together they have two beautiful children. Elkana sells paraffin retail in Sugoi on the outskirts of Eldoret town.  His wife Charity is a farmer and helps him in providing for the children.  He has been in his business for one year now and he gets a monthly income of 5,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be Elkana's first loan with KADET and he plans to buy more paraffin to sell. With the income he is going to get from the business he plans to pay school fees for his two children and provide them with basic needs like food.

In future Elkana plans to expand his business to have a bigger paraffin sales point and also to provide for his family's basic needs like sending them to good schools, buying good clothes, and raising their standard of living.

loans.use: To add more paraffin for resale in smaller quantities

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth operates a milling business in a highly populated area. She mills and sells maize flour for ugali (a staple food) and millet and sorghum flour for uji (porridge). She is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 to increase her stock of maize, millet and sorghum.

Ruth, 34 years old, is married and a mother to four children who are in school. She describes herself as stable and hopes to open more posho mill outlets in the future. Her five year plan is to buy a minibus for her business. Faulu Kenya has helped Ruth to build a home in the village.

loans.use: to increase her stock of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 53 years old, is a tea and dairy farmer. She is married to John, a tea farmer, and they have two adult children. Joyce has been doing tea and dairy farming for the past 10 years. Her monthly income is KES 6,000. She has applied for a loan in order to purchase dairy feed and fertilizer and to provide tea pruning labour. 

With the anticipated profit Joyce intends to venture into a new type of farming - poultry. She is applying for her second loan with Kadet as her first loan was paid successfully. Her hopes and dreams are to live her old age without stress together with her husband and to see her entire family settled.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed, buy farm supplies and hire labor

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agricultural industry. She lives in a 2-room brick house with her family in an area named Shamspura. She moved here 5 years ago. 

She is a very supportive lady who is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She is married to G. H., a painter by profession who paints houses and buildings by contract. Shahida lives in a combined family system with her brother-in-law who runs a grocery store in the market. She is a housewife who stays at home and does household work. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are very young and have not yet started school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her brother-in-law with his grocery store business. With the help of the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to sell at his store.  He has been operating this business for over 5 years and Shahida is confident that with the help of this loan he will be able to move his business into a better position. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 

Note: In the photo, Shahida is the woman who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en: Wallace, 33 years old,  sells spare parts in Nairobi; he employs one person. He has been in this business for three years and hopes to open a garage in the future. Faulu has empowered him by providing relevant financial solutions to him to ensure he always has sufficient stock. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to increase his stock of motor vehicle paints and spare parts. Wallace is married and a father of two.

loans.use: to increase his stock of motor vehicle paints and spare parts

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa, se conformó en agosto del 2008, en la zona de Trinidad, sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría al sector informal de la economía y se trasladan a diferentes zonas para realizar sus actividades por el poco movimiento comercial en la zona.
 Las señoras comentan que están contentas con el crédito recibido y tiene muchos deseos  de continuar accediendo al crédito que les es de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con sus actividades. 
 
Renuevan por 7 vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas. 
Ellas se sientes con más autoestima por el sentido de pertenencia a un comité y por el hecho de que hace 2 años que ya son clientes de la institución. 
La Señora Francisca G., directora general del comité tiene 29 años de edad, a quien al principio de asumir su cargo, le fue un poco difícil tomar las riendas del comité por su falta de experiencia para estar a cargo de un grupo y porque es una de las más jóvenes del grupo.  Pero con el tiempo fue tomando confianza y escuchando las recomendaciones para dirigir un grupo, hasta el punto de que hoy se desempeña de forma excelente en su comité y es muy apreciada por sus compañeras. 
Ella se dedica a atención de una cantina que posee donde vende comestibles de todo tipo y también bebidas y golosinas y solicita el préstamo para la abastecerse nuevamente de sus mercaderías y más aun en esta época en que la ventas de bebidas aumenta mucho.
Siempre agradecen la confianza de la fundación hacia las integrantes, ya que en ninguna otra institución financiera tendrían posibilidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The Women of Kuña Guapa Committee was formed in August of 2008 in the area of Trinidad. Its inhabitants mostly work in the informal sector of the economy and they go to different places to do their jobs because their is little commercial movement in the area.  The women state that they are happy with the loans they have received and they really want to continue to access the credit because it is a lot of help for getting ahead in their activities.  
 
They are renewing for the 7th time, going into the next cycle because of their excellent payment history. 
They have more self esteem from belonging to a committee and from being clients of the institution for 2 years. Mrs. Francisca G., general director of the committee, is 29 years old. When she first took over the job, it was a little difficult to take the reins of the committee because of a lack of experience of leading a group and because she is one of the youngest people in the group.  But with time she gained confidence and listened to recommendations for directing a group and today she performs excellently in the committee and is very appreciated by the other members. 
 
She works in a cantina she owns where she sells food of all types and also drinks and snacks. She is asking for the loan to supply herself again with merchandise, especially since beverage sales increase a lot at this time. 

They are always grateful for the trust the Foundation has in the members, since they would have no chance of a loan in any other institution.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, snacks and more.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with a teenage son Alexei. She is an entrepreneur from the agricultural region of Kamenka. In this part of Ukraine, most people earn their living by farming and Larisa is no exception. She owns two land lots on which she constructed 2 arch greenhouses and a third one for seedlings. Larisa decided to try her luck in the farming business 17 years ago. Ever since, she has invested 45,000 UAH in it and she spends about 18,000 UAH yearly on seeds and polyethylene film. 

Larisa is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase seeds and polyethylene film for her greenhouses. She is planning to reinvest the income she generates into further expansion of her business and into building more greenhouses on her property in the future. Larisa believes this sphere of agriculture has good potential for growth. She is willing to invest in her business to make it a successful enterprise, bringing her stable income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and polyethylene film

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith sells new clothes and cosmetics and repairs clothes in Nairobi. The area that Faith operates from is competitive and she has a reliable clientele. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy another sewing machine and add clothing display units. Faith, 34 years old, is married and is a mother of two. She describes herself as hardworking and reliable.

loans.use: buying another sewing machine and adding clothing display units

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is married with a grown son, Maxim.  She is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka who grows early spring vegetables.  Raisa owns four arch greenhouses and is in the process of constructing her fifth one.  She decided to try her luck in the greenhouse farming business five years ago.  She has already invested 90,000 UAH in this venture. Raisa spends about 25,000 UAH on seeds and polyethylene film every year.   

Raisa is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to finish the construction of a new greenhouse and buy polyethylene film.  She hopes to complete the construction process by the end of the year, which would allow her to plant and grow more tomatoes in the next farming season and thus generate additional income to be re-invested in her greenhouse business.

loans.use: To finish construction of a greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is married to A. R., who operates a business selling Punjabi food. He has a breakfast stall in the market where he offers traditional Punjabi food such as Halwa puri (a combination of sweet halwa, spicy chick peas and hot crunchy puris) and Nan channey (made with chick peas) to his customers. He has a good name in the area for his food's quality and taste.

Salma is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is the mother of 5 children, all of whom are enrolled in school and getting their education. Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his food stall business. With the loan, he will buy chick peas, cooking oil, flour, spices, etc. in bulk to help him make large quantities of food to sell. He has been operating this business for over 6 years and Salma is confident that he will be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment. Salma is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy required items for Punjabi food stall business

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Nicholas has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for over two years, offering transportation to travelers and passersby. Nicholas cites seasonality and thieves as his major challenges. He hopes to own another motorbike in the future. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business. With this KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase fuel and spares parts for his motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James M. is 28 years old and married. His wife stays at home to take care of household chores while James goes out every day to provide for his family. They have one child aged 3 years old whom they hope to educate to university level. James has been running a studio and selling picture frames to local people for three years. His business is located in Mwingi and he is served by SMEP's Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. James says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more picture frames to sell. In the future, he hopes to diversify to a retail shop. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to buy picture frames

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two children. She is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk. Valentina sells sportswear and footwear at two different locations: she owns an outlet in a local mall called ‘Bashny’ (‘Towers’) and a vending kiosk at the central city market. She has been in the market for about 10 years. Presently, Valentina has 65,000 UAH in turnover capital.  

Valentina is requesting a 10,000 UAH loan to reconstruct her vending facility at the local marketplace and increase assorted merchandise. Valentina usually purchases additional merchandise from wholesalers at affordable prices and then resells it at a higher price. She is hoping to have increased sales this holiday season and thus generate extra income for her family of four.

loans.use: To reconstruct her vending facility and increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of four and has been farming for four years. She produces eggs and milk, which she sells to the local market.

She has applied for this loan of 40,000 KES to expand her poultry business. Her major business challenge is poultry diseases, which are quite difficult to manage. She had previously acquired a loan of 25,000 KES. She believes this loan will help her to increase her income and pay for her children's education.

To supplement her income, Christine also has a clothing business. In the future, she wants to obtain a piece of land to expand her farming operation.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Santa María  surguió por contacto de una de las señoras con la fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 5º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009  con pagos excelentes.
La Directora General es la Sra. Claudia  P. es casada, su marido es docente y junto con ella se dedican a la fabricación y venta de chipas, ya que tienen una fabrica familiar que funciona hace aproximadamente 20 años.
Cuenta la Sra. Claudia que el  dinero que recibe dentro del comité lo invierte en la compra de insumos para la fabrica , lo cual es de mucho valor para ella y su familia , ya que de esta manera consiguen insumos en mejor precio y cantidad. De las  ganancias que le genera la venta ella  paga la cuota de su comité y el resto es un ingreso importante para su familia.
texts.en:
This group of the Barrio Santa María arose from the contact between one of the ladies and the foundation.  The group is in its 5th loan cycle with Fundación since the year 2009, with an excellent payment history.

The Director is Mrs. Claudia Pinto, who is married.  Her husband is a teacher, and together, they dedicate themselves to making and selling chipas (a traditional Paraguayan food, similar to bread, made with starch, cheese, milk, vegetable oil, etc.)  They have a family factory that has been working for about 20 years.

Mrs. Claudia states that she invests the funds she receives through the group into supplies for the factory.  This is of great value to her and her family because she can buy ingredients at better prices and larger quantities.  She uses the income she generates to make her group loan payment, and the rest of the revenue is important for her family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as yucca starch, cheese, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Estela Vallejo tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera tiene un hijo pequeño que aun depende económicamente de ella. Vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio 4 Potrero picada Pyta.

La señora María Estela es propietaria de un salón de belleza en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es peluquera y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela que concurre diariamente a su local para realizarse lavados, peinados, color y otros. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede educar a su hijo, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar. 

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas insumos para su peluquería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Stela Vallejo is 30 years old, she is a single mother and has a young child who is her dependant. She lives in her own house located at 4 Potrero Picada Pyta.

Mrs. Vallejo has a beauty salon in the center of the city Encarnacion. She has been a beautician for several years and has a lot of costumers. They go to her shop regularly for shampoo, hairstyling and coloring. She is able to provide for her son, her household and to take care of unforeseen expenses thanks to her shop.

Mrs. Vallejo is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Peter Ng'ang'a

texts.en:
Peter is a 46-year-old farmer. He is married to Florence, who is also a farmer. They have three children. Peter has owned his farming business for the past three years. He has a dairy operation and grows crops. His monthly income is 13,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.  

Peter has never borrowed from a MFI (microfinance institution) before. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a Kadet credit officer. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use to purchase animal feeds (i.e., dairy meal, maize jam, and Macklin salt), fertilizers, and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business he intends to expand the dairy operation and begin greenhouse farming. 

He hopes to own a greenhouse in the near future, which will enable him to grow produce during all the seasons. With the profits, he will pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds, fertilizer, and seedlings

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
39-year-old Phoebe is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya.  She has been in the farming business for 16 years, producing maize, beans, vegetables, and eggs. She has employed one farmhand.  She has 3 children, all of school-going age.

She has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to enable her to expand her poultry business.  She says this loan will provide income that will ensure that her children get enough food as well as education.  She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

She does not have any income of her own but believes her husband, who operates a second-hand cloth business, may help in repaying the loan once given.  She would like Juhudi Kilimo to advance higher amounts to enable clients to have bigger businesses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 31 years old and is married to Bruce. She has a business of making traveling bags, which she has been operating for two years with a profit of about 6,250 Kenya shillings. Her spouse is a business man and contributes to the family’s income.

She is taking her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous ones successfully. She intends to use the loan to buy materials to make traveling bags. 

She hopes to expand her business and become a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to buy more machines and create jobs for other Kenyans.

loans.use: To buy materials to make traveling bags

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel S.   tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado  con Patrocinia Escobar  viven en casa propia en San Juan del Parana.
Se dedica a la venta  de ropas que trae de Buenos Aires y Posadas  vende en la zona de Encarnación, y colonia obligado Hohenau.
 Es una Persona muy   trabajadora y gracias a las actividades que realizan han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo en sus micro-empresas.
El destino del crédito es para realizar comprar  de mas mercaderías como remeras, jeans, shorts, camisas y otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel S. is 46 years old, he is married to Patrocinia Escobar. They live in their own house in San Juan del Parana.

He brings clothes from Buenos Aires and Posadas and sells them in the zone of Encarnacion and  Colonia Obligado, Hohenau. He is a hard worker and because of his work activities has been able to progress and bring growth to his micro-business.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise like T-shirts, jeans, shorts and the like.

loans.use: To buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts, jeans and dresses

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald M. is 34 years old and runs a motorcycle transport business as his primary business.  He also sells eggs as his secondary business. He is married to Rose Muthoki and together they have two children, aged seven years and six months. Gerald has been running these two businesses for 4 years and he gets a monthly profit of Kshs 6000.

He was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. With the loan he plans to increase the stocks of eggs in his secondary business and if the loan boosts his business he plans to expand it to a wholesale shop.

Gerald describes himself as hard-working and dreams of having a big wholesale shop and many motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of eggs

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a computer and a tool box for his business. He operates "Mass Wave", a mobile phone repair shop in a busy part of Nairobi. He is 25 years old and married. Geoffrey is a member of Kikwetu SHG and the group has guaranteed this loan. He describes himself as quiet, humble, hard-working and focused.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a tool box

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy computers for her Internet cafe. She runs "Mother's Choice", an internet cafe in a busy part of Nairobi. She employs two people and has been in this business for eight years. Her customers are mainly low and middle income earners. At the age of 46, Gladys is a single mother of a fifteen year old who is in school. She hopes to own and run a big computer supply firm in the future. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
Freddy Gilbert G. M. tiene 40 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y con el hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Freddy se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño comprar terrenos para trabajar.

Le gusta jugar volly
texts.en:
Freddy Gilbert G. M. is 40 years old. He lives with her common-law wife and their son. They live in Canton de Ventanas in the Los Rios Province.

The members of V.R.C., El Recreo, are dedicated exclusively to farming mostly growing products with short cycles like corn, rice, soy and beans. Twelve members are from the same sector; San Vicente, Las Lomas, Canton de Ventanas in the Los Rios Province. 

Freddy has been dedicated to farming for the last three years, planting mostly corn. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the open market in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers to cultivate corn. This loan will provide economic assistance to make the purchases. The members encounter challenges with diseases, pests and climate changes. 

He enjoys volleyball and his dream is to buy land to farm.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Ronald

texts.es:
Juan Ronald G. M. tiene 24 años. Es soltero,  vive con los padres,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño mejorar la situación económica.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Ronald G. M. is 24 years old, single and lives with this parents in the area of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos, he has no children.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Juan is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Juan needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers to grow corn. The loan will help him meet his financial needs. His crops face infestations and disease and climate changes. Juan’s dream is to improve his economic situation.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Celia Jenny

texts.es:
Celia Jenny G. M.  tiene 41 años. Es viuda,  vive con los padres y con un hijo,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.
