Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Celia se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seguir trabajando por un futuro mejor.
Le gusta leer.
texts.en:
Celia Jenny G. M. is 41 years old, she is widowed and lives with her parents and son, she lives in the area of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos, and she has 1 son.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Celia is a farmer and she specializes in growing corn, she has done so for 3 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in a market in the same city.

Celia needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn crops. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. Some problems that she faces are plagues and disease and climate change. Her dream is to keep working for a better future.

Celia enjoys reading.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: John Ihuthia

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, married to Ruth, and is a father of one daughter who is one year old. He operates a retail shop in Limuru town, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi city. This is his primary business and he has been running it for the last four years. Limuru is a relatively busy center in terms of business and has a high population as well. This is favorable for any business.

He found out about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his second loan with KADET and has not borrowed from other financiers before.  With this loan, John plans to buy maize flour, tea leaves, sugar, margarine and milk for his shop so that he can get better returns. 

He hopes to open another shop in Ngarariga Shopping Center, which is 4km from Limuru town, in two years time.

loans.use: John wants to buy sugar, some tea leaves, maize flour, and other small items for his shop.

loans.name: Esther Nyambura

texts.en:
Esther Nyambura is a 50-year-old divorcee and has one child. She runs a green grocery shop where she has been for the past 10 years, with an income of Kshs. 4,000 a month.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd and she intends to use it to buy more stock of tomatoes and cabbages for her green grocery business. She has never borrowed from another MFI and she hopes to buy a plot of land and build her permanent house and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Mariuxi Yesenia

texts.es:
Mariuxi Yesenia G. M.  tiene 29 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con el hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Mariuxi se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mayores ingresos en el negocio y dar lo necesario para la educación al hijo.
Le gusta leer.
texts.en:
Mariuxi Yesenia G. M. is 29 years old. She is in a common law marriage and lives with her partner and son. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Mariuxi is a farmer and specializes in growing corn which she has done for some 3 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in a market in the same city.

Mariuxi needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn crops. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. Some problems that she faces are plagues and disease and climate change. Her dream is to have more profits from her business and to have everything her son needs for his education.

Mariuxi enjoys reading.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sophia Wanjiru

texts.en:
Sophia is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She stays in Limuru from where she operates her milk business. This is a middle class town and with a high population. She buys and sells milk to the residents of the place and also supplies to others from the surrounding region. This is her primary business, which she has been doing for the last 13 years. 

She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has borrowed from another financial institution before. She is thus well versed with Microfinance Institutions. With this loan she plans to buy high grade cows so that she is able to get more milk to be able to supply to all her customers within the area. Since she will not need to buy the milk from other clients then the milk from her cows will increase the quantity that she sells to her neighbors.

loans.use: Sophia plans to buy a cow which will add the number of liters of milk she sells to her clients.

loans.name: Milton Jacinto

texts.es:
Milton Jacinto L. S. tiene 44 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Milton se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seguir trabajando en el negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Milton Jacinto L. S. is 44 years old; he is in a common law marriage and lives with his partner and 4 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Milton is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 3 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Milton needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him to meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is to keep working in his business.

Milton enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: Benedict is 32 years old and married. He sells fish in a busy market in Nairobi. His main customers are women and his business environment is conducive. He is requesting for a loan of Kes 50,000 to add stock of fish. He also owns a motor parts shop in one of Nairobi estates for extra income. Benedict is hard-working and hopes to have a large shop wholesaling hardware items in the future. In five years, Benedict  plans to buy a vehicle and a home for his family. He has been empowered economically since joining Faulu and he has also developed a culture of saving.

loans.use: To add stock of fish

loans.name: Kleber Washington

texts.es:
Kleber Washington  P. A. tiene 37 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Milton se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño tener salud y vida para seguir trabajando para darles la educación a los hijos.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Kleber Washington P. A. is 37 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and 4 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Kebler is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 3 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets in the same city.

Kebler needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him to meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is to be healthy and live enough to keep working to give his children an education.

Kebler enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya where she has been farming and producing tomatoes, cabbages, fine beans and kale, selling them to the local market. 

She has applied for this loan of 40,000 KES to venture into the poultry business, specializing in broilers and layers. She hopes to make her business a large-scale one in the future. She had previously acquired a loan of 20,000 KES and repaid it. She believes the acquisition of this loan will increase her income, help her expand her shoe selling business which she operates within the town and pay her children's school fees

Evangeline says she is diversifying since there is much competition in the fine beans business, making prices very low.She says Juhudi Kilimo loans have revolutionized commercial farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Racheal Wangui

texts.en:
Racheal is married to Patrick and together they have four children. She lives in Limuru which is not far from Nairobi. This is a business and farming region with good rainfall. Racheal has been involved in farming as her primary business for a number of years, planting various vegetables such as cabbage and kale. 

Racheal got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she will buy seeds in readiness for the planting season which starts soon. Racheal hopes to own a dairy farm and be able to supply milk to the residents and the market center.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in readiness for the planting season

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe O. W. is 27 years old and married. He and his wife have three children aged between 2 and 6 years old whom they hope to educate to the university level. His business is located in the busy city of Kisumu. He has been selling tea to the local people for four years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is weather conditions since he has to walk to sell the tea. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy tea bags to sell to the local people. He hopes to expand his business and get a permanent premises to operate the tea business which he likes so much. He describes himself as observant.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves

loans.name: Felipe Francisco

texts.es:
Felipe Francisco  A. B. tiene 47 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Felipe se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño tener salud.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felipe Francisco A. B. is 47 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and 3 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Felipe is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Felipe needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is to be healthy.

Felipe enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Janeth Magaly

texts.es:
Janeth Magaly  C. C. tiene 39 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con el hijo,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Janeth se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar cacao.
Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Janeth Magaly C. C. is 39 years old she lives in a common law marriage with her partner and child. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Janeth is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Janeth needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn crops. The loan will help her to meet her financial needs. Some problems that she faces are plagues and disease and climate change. Janeth’s dream is to buy land to grow cocoa.

She enjoys cooking.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a 30-year-old businessman. He operates a cereal shop where he sells beans, rice, mung beans and other grains. He has operated this business, in a densely-populated residential area, for two years and hopes to become a supplier of grain for more profits in the future. Jared is married and the father of two. He describes himself as hardworking and focused. Since joining Faulu, his economic status has improved and life has become better. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy beans, rice, ndengu (mung beans) and other grains for sale. This loan is guaranteed by his group.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, ndengu (mung beans) and other grains

loans.name: Peter Kimani

texts.en:
Peter is 56 years old and married to Esther. He is the father of four children aged between 21 and 28 years old. He operates a restaurant in Limuru town, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi town. This is his primary business -- he has been running it for the last two years. Besides this, he is also doing some farming. Limuru is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population as well. This is favorable for any business. His customers are mainly the residents of Limuru town and its environs.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his fourth loan with KADET. He has not borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, Peter plans to buy phone accessories for a shop he is setting up, which also includes phone repair services. He wants to restock his restaurant with food stuffs so that he has enough to serve his customers. This will help him boost his income and give his family a better life and a better education for his children.

loans.use: Peter wants to buy phone accessories, in addition to restocking his restaurant.

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio  V. Z. tiene 40 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Joffre se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño comprar terrenos para seguir en el negocio.
Le gusta manejar el carro.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio V. Z. is 40 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and 2 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Joffre is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Joffre needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him to meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is buy land to keep working in the field.

Joffre enjoys driving his car.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sinore

texts.en:
Sinore S. is a 37-year-old woman. She sells traditional belts, shawls and jewelry at Enkaroni market in Bissil to individuals and other traders who take them to the busy Namanga Road near Tanzania and Nairobi. Her husband, S. N., aged 40 years, is a farmer. Together they have three children: Charles, 14 years old; Lemayon, 10 years old; and Sopiato, 4 years old. Sinore has been running her business for thirteen years; her monthly profit is Kshs 12,000.

Sinore was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela Office. With the loan, she will use Kshs 10,000 to buy jewelry and beads and Kshs 10,000 to buy traditional shawls. If the loan boosts the business, Sinore plans to build a shop and stock it with jewelry and traditional shawls.

Sinore describes herself as hardworking and ambitious; she dreams that one day she will be able to transport jewelry to Nairobi city and open a stall at the Masai Market.

loans.use: To buy shawls, belts and beads for making jewelry.

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es: Sra. Lisseth tiene 21 años de edad  oriunda de Santa Cruz el Torno  actualmente vive en la zona de Puerto Rico hace  12 años. Su Actividad es la venta de productos medicinales en la zona del torno y nueva terminal hace 3 años normalmente vende sus productos medicinales antes que salgan los buses, también ofrece sus productos en los buses, su estado civil separado hace 2 años y cuenta con 2 hijos a cargo,  El Destino del crédito es para la compra de productos medicinales por cantidad, es una persona joven pero muy  trabajadora que sola tiene que velar por la salud y educación de sus pequeños.   La Sra. se siente muy agradecida con emprender por la confianza depositada
texts.en: Mrs. Lisseth is 21 years old, she hails from Santa Cruz el Torno and at present she lives in the Puerto Rico area where she has lived for 12 years. She has sold medicinal products for some 3 years in the el Torno area and in a new bus terminal. She usually sells her medicinal products before the buses leave; she also offers her products on the buses. Mrs. Lisseth has been separated for 2 years and she has 2 children under her care. The loan will be used to buy medicinal products; she is young but she is a very hardworking person since she is alone and has to watch over the wellbeing and education of her children. She is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) for the trust given to her.

loans.use: To buy merchandize wholesale.

loans.name: Lenah Nyambura

texts.en:
Lenah Nyambura is a 38-year-old single mother of three children. She runs a beauty shop, as well as a grocery store as a secondary business. She has had these businesses for two years with an income of 39,000 KES.

She is taking her first loan with KADET which she will use to buy beauty products and hair extensions. She has never borrowed from another MFI--this will be her first loan from such an institution. 

She hopes to expand her business and educate her children so that they can realize their dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is thirty years old and married to Penninah. He has two children and supports three other relatives. He has a retail shop where he sells cornmeal, wheat flour, soap and detergent. He has been in the business for eight months with an income of 25,000 KES a month.

This is his second loan with KADET and he plans to add more stocks of sugar, flour, soap and detergent to his shop. He has never borrowed from another MFI. 

He hopes to expand his business and be sustainable.

loans.use: To buy stocks of sugar, flour, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Lizette Veronica

texts.es: Lizette Verónica tiene 36 años es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La experiencia que tiene en su negocio es muy satisfactoria, la ubicación de su negocio es en su propia casa de habitación,   desde hace 11 años pues Lizette atiende a sus clientes con un cálido trato logra que la visiten más seguido para realizar sus compras. Gracias a la buena administración de su negocio ha podido surtir un poco mas como golosinas, refrescos, agua, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, jugos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima de todo lo que ofrece. Ella ha trabajado mucho por salir adelante ya que tiene varias metas  como seguir ayudando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en: Lizette Verónica is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her 3 children who are in her care.  The experience which she has in her business is very satisfactory.  Her business is located in her own home.  For 11 years Lizette has been serving her customers warmly.  This way she has managed to ensure they visit her again more quickly to do their shopping.  Thanks to the good running of her business, she has been able to stock her store a little more with products such as candies, soda, water, basic grains, detergents, soups and juice.  She is requesting this loan to buy more of everything she offers.  She has worked a lot to get ahead as she has several goals such as continuing to help her children in their studies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old rice farmer and a masonry businessman. He is married to Jane, a farmer, and they have three children. John has been doing rice farming and operating a masonry business for the past 10 years. His monthly income is KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He has applied for his second loan from KADET in order to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer, sprays and pay for the welding labor. With the anticipated profits from the business, John intends to improve his family's living standard and educate his children. His hopes are to educate his children to the highest level possible and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and sprays

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Dolores Del Socorro tiene 25 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 11 años que trabaja pues siempre ha sido una madre responsable, pues ella ayudaba a su Madre, pues su Mama no ganaba un salario estable en donde pudiera ofrecerle a Dolores estudios fue por estos motivos que ella empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta y así ayudar a sufragar estos gastos que son muy necesaR.. El motivo del financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños y trajes formales.
texts.en: Dolores del Socorro is 25 years old and her activity is clothing sales.  She has been working for more than 11 years, as she has always been a responsible mother.  She helped her own mother, who did not have a stable enough income to be able to afford an education for Dolores.  Because of this, she started working on her own so she could cover these very necessary expenses.  The reason she is requesting the loan is to buy items such as skirts, pants, shirts, children’s clothing, and formal wear.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, casada tiene un hijo, trabaja en una tienda vendiendo joyas como empleada.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar oro y plata y elaborar joyas con su familia, pues tienen experiencia en este tipo de trabajo, para de esta manera poner su propio negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro ya fue parte de Kiva; paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in her parents’ house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone of the city of La Paz.  She is married, has one child, and is a jewelry store employee.

She is requesting this loan to buy gold and silver to make jewelry with her family, as they have experience in this type of work.  This would allow her to start her own business and improve her income.

She is a client of Impro and already a Kiva participant; she repays her loans properly, which has allowed her access to credit again.

loans.use: To buy gold and silver for making jewelry to then sell.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
El señora R.  cliente antigua de edad 39  años vive en la Localidad  del torno Barrio las palmas  hace 8 años, oriunda  del departamento de Chuquisaca.      
                                                                                                              Estado civil: concubina con el señor Alejandro hace 14 años y cuenta con la actividad de distribuidor de productos medicinales. 
                                                                                                             Actividad: venta de productos medicinales hace 10 años en la zona del torno y nueva terminal, el destino del crédito para aumentar capital de trabajo en su negocio con la compra de mercadería.  Los clientes están agradecidos porque nuevamente confiamos en ellos y agilizamos su préstamos para poder invertir en lo que ellos necesitan a lavez aumentar capital de trabajo
texts.en:
R. is a long-time client who is 39 years old, has lived in the Las Palmas neighborhood for 8 years, and is a native of the Chuquisaca region.  

She has been married to Alejandro for 14 years, and is a distributor of medicinal products.  

She has been selling these products for 10 years in the del Torno and Nueva Terminal zones.  The loan is meant to augment her business’ working capital to buy merchandise.  

The clients are grateful that we once again have confidence in them, and facilitate their loans so they can invest in what they need for their business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Rene

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rene vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la zona de Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una empresa como secretaria, el esposo tiene una empresa unipersonal y viaja constantemente.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar la matrícula y pensiones en la universidad para su hijo menor, en la carrera de auditoria

Es cliente de Impro, paga muy bien y por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Rene lives in her own home, with her husband and two children, in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria zone in the city of La Paz.  She works as a secretary at an enterprise, and her husband has his own business and travels constantly.

The loan she is requesting is to pay for her youngest child’s university expenses, towards a career in auditing.

Being an Impro client, reliable with payments, and of good character, have qualified her to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To pay for university expenses for her youngest child, towards a career in auditing.

loans.name: Angel Armando

texts.es: El señor O. G. Angel Armando, tiene 47 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, es casado vive en casa familiar, con direccion Raul Boza 335 Subtanjalla, casa de material noble de una planta. El Es Operario de construccion  se dedica a este rubro hace mas de cinco año.El señor tiene metas  trazadas y obejetivos, en futuro quiere crecer y tener todos sus implementos para asi dar un mejor servicio, con el credito piensa invertir en sus gastos personales y asi ganar experiencia crediticia con la entidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Ormenno G., Angel Armando is 47 years old; he is married and has 4 adult children. They live in the family home at Raul Boza 335 Subtanjalla, a one story wooden house.

He is a construction worker and has been in this trade for more than five years. He has goals for the future, He would like to increase his work and have all the implements necessary to give better service.

He will utilize this loan for personal expenses and through it hopes to gain credit experience with the financial institution.

loans.use: He will utilize the loan for personal expenses

loans.name: Lester Roberto

texts.es: Lester Roberto tiene 23 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de distribución de pepsi. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, la comercialización de sus productos las realiza a camiones repartidores, que son los que se encargan de abastecer las diferentes pulperías, Lester busca la manera de trasladarlos ya que las distancias son muy largas. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima ya que se acerca una muy buena temporada y quiere ofrecer una gran variedad. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Lester Roberto is 23 years old.  He has a Pepsi distribution business which he has had for more than 3 years.  He sells his products through delivery trucks which supply all the different grocery stores.  Lester is looking for a way to move them since the distances are very long.  He will use his loan to buy raw materials since a very good season is approaching and he would like to offer a wide range.  He dreams of improving his income and expanding his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ibyiringiro Group

texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years old and single. She sells a variety of consumable goods such as bread, juice, milk and yogurt in her shop. She has been running this business for the past two years. Silvia is the leader of a group called Ibyiringiro CB which, translated from the Kinyarwanda language, means The Hope in English. The members of this group have different kinds of businesses but are all committed to making change in their lives. Through requesting this loan, they will be able to upgrade and improve their businesses.

Silvia believes her business has improved many aspects of her life. She is in the photo at the back on the left, holding a passbook of Urwego. She is planning to purchase more merchandise and restock her inventory in the future.

loans.use: to buy more juice, bread and yogurt to sell

loans.name: Arselia Epifania

texts.es:
El señora Arcelia cliente antigua de edad de 46 años vive en la zona de la Guardia barrio villa Fátima hace  5 años, oriunda  del departamento de Cochabamba, se fue a Santa Cruz buscando nueva oportunidad para salir adelante.                                                                                                     Estado civil: concubina con la sr Fernando de edad 48 años cuenta con la actividad de carpintero hace   12 años, al Sr. Le va muy bien, la señora tiene  con 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.                                                                                                                                                                                                             Actividad: es la venta de desayuno y merienda   hace 20 años  en la zona de la guardia mercado de la zona, Destino del crédito  es para la compra de una heladera  para su negocio. 
La cliente están agradecida porque nuevamente confiamos en ellos y agilizamos su préstamo para poder invertir en lo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Arcelia is an old client of Emprender.  She is 46 years old and has lived in La Guardia district, in Villa Fátima neighborhood for 5 years.  She originally comes from the department of Cochabamba but went to Santa Cruz looking for a new opportunity to get ahead.  She lives with Fernando who is 48 years old.  He has been working as a carpenter for 12 years and his business is doing very well.  Arcelia has 4 school-aged children.  She works selling breakfasts and afternoon meals in the district market of La Guardia.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She will use her loan to buy a fridge for her business.

Arcelia is grateful that we are trusting in her again and are providing her with a loan so that she can invest in what she needs.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; tiene 40 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasteles, ella los envía hacia la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y también la socia trabaja en un programa de productos naturales, la socia quiere tener una pastelería. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasteles al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Luz Marina is 40 years old.  She is single and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cakes.  She sends her cakes to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She also works in a natural products program.  Luz Marina would like to own a cake shop.  She is requesting this loan to buy cakes wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cakes wholesale

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is 45 years old and married. Two of her children are adults and the other two are in school. She runs a shoe sales business in a busy market in Nairobi with a good flow of customers. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to increase her stock of shoes for sale. This loan is guaranteed by her group. She has been in this business for five years and hopes to own a plot of land in the future. Due to the loans she has been receiving from Faulu Kenya, Annah's stock has increased. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes

loans.name: Lezia Heloise

texts.fr:
Héloïse est une vendeuse de tissus qui a remboursée le précédent prêt avec succès. Elle avait reçu les enseignements au près de HOPE qui lui ont permis d’améliorer ses ventes et ses bénéfices.

Elle avait plus achetée les tissus de luxes et de cérémonies pour attirer  les clients.
Avec le prochain prêt,  elle va renforcer son stock de tissus en ajoutant : les tissus d’uniforme scolaire, les tissus pour hommes, les tissus pour les tenues de soirée  pour les dames, des rouleaux de popeline couleurs variés.
Son chiffre d’affaire a augmenté, de 5000f/jour et maintenant elle vend 30000f/jour.

Sa vie s’est améliorée et elle veut faire de l’importation pour générer plus de bénéfices et s’occuper de la solarite de ses deux enfants.
texts.en:
Heloise is a vendor selling fabrics. She successfully repaid her prior loan. She has received some advice from HOPE allowing her to increase her sales volume and her benefits.

She then purchased more luxury and special-occasion fabrics to attract clients. With her new loan, she is going to expand her stock, by adding fabrics for school uniforms, fabrics for men’s clothing, fabrics for ladies’ evening outfits, and rolls of poplin in various colors. Her sales have increased from 5000 West African francs per day to 30000 West African Francs per day. Her life has improved, and she would like to import goods in order to further increase her income and provide for the education of her two children.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics, such as silk, satine,  cotton piqué, satiny cotton "super 100, 150" etc

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes; tiene 38 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas y también se dedica se dedica a la crianza de pollos, la socia se dedica a realizar los acabados de las chompas y luego los vende a una empresa, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de crianza de pollos. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construccion para construir su casa.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lourdes is 38 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sweaters and also her business raising chickens.  She finishes the sweaters off and then sells them to a company.  She would like to improve her chicken-raising business.  She is requesting this loan to buy building materials to build her house.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build her house

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy, age 37, has operated a tailoring business for 12 years. She makes and sells new clothes and does mending on older clothes. She also makes and sells bags. 

She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy stocks of fabric.

A single mother of one, Bancy describes herself as hard-working, and she hopes to open more outlets in future. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Bancy's life has changed and her business has grown.

loans.use: To buy stocks of fabric

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: El señora Beatriz cliente antigua de edad de49  años vive en la zona de la Guardia barrio 3 de Mayo  hace 35 años, oriunda  del departamento de Santa Cruz.                                                                                                                      Estado civil: soltera, hace 30 años cuenta con 1 hija a su Cargo.                                                                                                                                                                                                          Actividad: venta de pollo y chorizo y pato cuenta con este negocio hace 10 años en el mercado de la zona.                                                                                                                                                                                                 Destino del crédito: para la compra de chanchos y patos para ir engordándolos ya que para este fin de año tiene bastantes pedidos.                                                                                                                                                                                      La Sra. Es un apersona muy trabajadora se esforzó para que su hija salga profesional,  está agradecida por que nuevamente confiamos en ella y agilizamos su prestamos para poder invertir en lo que ella necesita y así poder aumentar capital de trabajo
texts.en: Beatriz is an old client of Emprender.  She is 49 years old and lives in La Guardia district in the 3 de Mayo neighborhood.  She has lived there for 35 years and is originally from the department of Santa Cruz.  Beatriz has been single for 30 years.  She has one daughter in her care.  Her business is selling chicken, chorizo and duck in the district market.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She will use her loan to buy pigs and ducks to fatten since she has a lot of orders for the end of the year.  Beatriz is a very hard-working lady who works hard so that her daughter can become a professional.  She is grateful that we are trusting in her again and we are providing her with a loan so that she can invest in what she needs and thereby increase her working capital.

loans.use: Working capital and to buy pigs

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr:
Judith  est vendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine qu’elle achetait dans les dépôts et magasins de poto-poto.

Le prêt passé a été très bénéfique pour elle, elle a eue un plus dans la manière d’exercer son commerce.
De 5000f 10000f par  jour, elle vendait maintenant 30000f à 40000f  jour apres le premier pret..

Femme de caractère, elle contrôle son activité jour après jour en se basant sur son journal de caisse. 
Le prochain prêt, va lui faciliter entre autre d’augmenter  le stock de sa marchandise et d’améliorer ses services au près de sa clientèle .
elle va faire venir sa marchandise de la chine ; de Dubaï, de Kinshasa, de Cotonou et même de Pointe-Noire afin de générer des bénéfices considérables.
Pour sa famille, elle se bat pour que les études de ses enfants marchent bien et dans peu de temps commencer a construire une maison pour ses enfants
texts.en:
Judith sells kitchen utensils which she buys in warehouses and stores of Poto-Poto [a neighborhood of Brazzaville]. The previous loan has been very helpful to her. She has been able to manage her business better. Her sales used to be between 5000 and 10,000 West African Francs per day, and after her first loan her daily receipts are now between 30, 000 and 40,000 per day.

A spirited woman, she  manages her business carefully, leaning over her receipts book day after day. The new loan will allow her, among other things, to expand her merchandise stock and provide a better service to her customers. She would like to export  goods from China, Dubai, Kinshasa, Cotonou and even from Pointe-Noire in order to be able to achieve significant revenues. She works very hard for the sake of her family,  to ensure that her children’s studies go well and, in the near future, to start building a  house for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing dishes, pots, glasses,  stemware and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ines Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ines Milagros; tiene 33 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant llamado el club de nutrición, donde brindan servicio de desayunos, almuerzos y cenas saludables, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines Milagros belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ines Milagros is 33 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant which is called “El Club de Nutrición” (The Nutrition Club).  She provides healthy breakfasts, afternoon meals and suppers.  She works from 7.00am until 9.00pm and would like to improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cooking products.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cooking products

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines; tiene 51 años de edad, y es soletra y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mates filtrantes, ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mates filtrantes al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ines is 51 years old, single and has 1 child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling herbal teas which she distributes to grocery stores.  She would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy herbal teas wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy herbal teas wholesale

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; tiene 41 años de edad, y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carros, la socia también vende repuestos de vehículos, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de carros. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de vehículos.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Carmen Rosa is 41 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling cars.  She also sells spare parts for vehicles.  She works from 9.00am to 6.00pm and would like to improve her car sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy spare parts.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. With this KES 20,000 loan, Yusuf wants to open a restaurant and purchase maize flour, beans, cooking oil, tomatoes and potatoes for it. His potential customers are market dwellers and neighbours. He hopes to expand and operate a hotel in the future. Yusuf decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and purchase maize flour, beans, cooking oil, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
ALICE MFOULOU N.

Madame Alice est dans l’habillement des enfants depuis 18ans, son stock est souvent renouvelé car elle fait des commandes dans les pays comme : la chine,  Cotonou et l' Afrique du sud.
Le prêt passé lui a permis d’acheter : des robes, des pantalons jeans mixtes, des chaussettes, des  chemisiers et polos, des sandales,  chaussures et autres articles pour enfants.
Ses revenus journaliers sont passés de 25000f à 60000f car elle avait les articles de qualites, rares a des prix abordables.   

Le prêt prochain sera le bien venu car il  arrive au moment des fêtes des enfants, car idéal pour elle serait de s'approvisionner en robettes, des robes, des culottes des ensembles vestes,pantalons, jupes, des chemises,
Sandales, chaussures, slips…
Elle a reçu les enseignements sur la gestion de son commerce et veut en profiter  pour faire plus de bénéfices.
Elle est entrain de s'investir pour aller a bout de son projet; devenir une femme d'affaire de renommee.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alice has been in the children's clothing business for 18 years. Her stock is constantly changing because she orders from places such as China, Cotonou (Benin), and South Africa. Her last loan allowed her to buy dresses, pants, men's and women's jeans, socks, men's shirts and polos, sandals, shoes, and other children's clothing.

Her daily income has gone from 25,000 to 60,000 francs because she has quality clothing, rare at affordable prices. The upcoming loan will be most welcome, as it comes at the same time as the children's holidays. Ideally she will be able to stock pinafores, dresses, pants, suits, trousers, skirts, blouses, sandals, shoes, and underwear.

She has received business management training and would like to use it to increase her profits. She is committed to reaching her goal:  becoming a well-known business woman.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for children, women, and men

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen de 33 años, vende artículos y bisutería en un puesto en la calle. Vive con sus dos hijos de 10 y 12 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Desde que se separo de su esposo ella comenzó a realizar actividades comerciantes para poder mantener a sus hijos en una situación económica estable. Inicio sus ventas vendiendo bisutería y productos personales poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar bisutería de todo tipo hasta que pudo conseguir un puesto en la calle para vender su mercadería. En la actualidad ella realiza su actividad comercial desde las 07h00am hasta las 15h00pm para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes y artículos navideños ya que por estas épocas se incrementa la demanda. En el futuro quiere mejorar sus ventas para poder comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old.  She sells articles and costume jewelry from a street stall.  She lives with her two children aged 10 and 12 in an urban area which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are salespeople.  It is called Guayaquil suburb.

Since she separated from her husband, she began selling merchandise as a way to support her children in a stable economic situation.  She started off selling costume jewelry and personal products and, little by little, with effort, she bought lots of different types of costume jewelry until she managed to get a street stall from which to sell her merchandise.  She currently works in her business from 7.00am to 3.00pm so that she can spend more time with her children.

She will use her loan to buy toys and Christmas products since demand increases during this season.  In the future she would like to improve her sales and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy toys and Christmas products

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.es:
el sr. Doroteo R. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la compra de reses y cerdos para  destazo. Don Tellito como mas se le conoce en la zona de Jamastran tiene mas de 20 años de dedicarse al destazo de animales y es una persona muy reconocida en toda la zona por la actividad a la que se dedica.
Los animales los destaza en su casa de habitación donde tiene un local espacialmente para la carnicería y también el sale a vender de manera ambulante a diferentes aldeas y comunidades circunvecinas a la aldea de jutiapa donde ya tiene los clientes a quines solo les va a entregar el producto.
Su negocio se ve que ha sido bien rentable por la condiciones de vida en que vive.
Don tellito vive en unión libre y su compañera de hogar se dedica a los oficios domésticos y toda su vida les a dedicado tiempo a sus hijos de los cuales ya solo 2 dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de vacas y cerdos para destazar y asi vender mas carne para obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Doroteo R.'s main business activity is buying cows and pigs to slaughter.  Don Tellito, as he is better known in the district of Jamastran, has been in business slaughtering animals for more than 20 years.  He is a very well-known person throughout his whole district because of the work he does.

He slaughters the animals at home where he has a special space for his butcher's shop.  He also goes out to sell in different neighboring villages and communities which are near the village of Jutiapa.  Here he already has customers who he provides his products to.

Looking at the conditions in which he lives, one can see that his business has been very profitable.

Don Tellito lives with his common-law wife who does domestic jobs and all their lives they have devoted time to their children of whom only 2 still depend on them.

He will use his loan to buy cows and pigs to slaughter and thereby sell more meat and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy cows and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shirts, ties, polos, t-shirts and socks

loans.name: Nila Esther

texts.es: Nilia A. es una mujer de 41 años que encontró un negocio que le apasiona y no es otro que el de comercializar calzado, bolso y algunas veces ropa; ella siempre esta dispuesta a servir a su clientes y con una sonrisa, buena fe y optimismo, recibe el mejor regalo a cambio:   la compra de sus productos; sus actividades las inicia desde muy temprano, cuando ella se dispone a atender a   sus hijos de 7 y 12 años, y el resto del día, mientras ellos están en el colegio, comienza su tarea de comercializar, recuperar el dinero y  observar   mercancías y precios de todo lo que vende; Para acceder a los proveedores de Bucaramanga, se fue a experimentar con los productos de todo lo relacionado con  el cuero, allí conoció los mejores del mercado y desde entonces hace el pedido desde Barranquilla y ellos se lo envían.  La ropa y los  electrodomésticos menores, los consigue  en el municipio de  Maicao y solo los vende en épocas especiales como en Diciembre cuando el mercado le exige, porque es muy ecuánime en el manejo de su inversión. Ella inició en el año 2003 su vinculación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, de la cual se siente muy satisfecha porque no solo ha recibido financiamiento, sino también asesoría en las inversiones empresariales. En la actualidad está solicitando su credikiva, que es su cuarto crédito para comprar vestidos para damas y calzado, atendiendo a la temporada de fiestas familiares, grados, cumpleaños, matrimonios y despedidas de soltera, fiestas que usualmente trae el fin de año y que  sus compradores  saben, que con toda confianza pueden recurrir a Nila, para de manera fácil y económica, lograr conseguir lo que necesitan o desean.  Sus clientes son sus vecinos, referidos, familiares y empleados de la empresa donde su hermana trabaja, los cuales conforman su mayor número de compradores y a todos ellos  sostiene con los productos de la calidad que ellos requieran, otorgándole plazos de pagos adaptados a sus posibilidades, y sobre todo con un trato amable,  aplicando su vocación de servicio. El negocio de Nila presenta una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de   26 días, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 18,5%  y tiene una capacidad de endeudamiento   de un   10%.   Ella cuenta que desde que está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha mejorado su liquidez con los financiamientos y también ha encontrado siempre una asesoría en el tema de cómo invertir o diversificar sus productos. Su meta y gran desafío es tener su casa propia,  por eso  Nila, vive en función de encontrar oportunidades para generar más ingresos que acompañen la gestión de su cónyuge y poder lograr convertir su sueño de brindarles a sus hijos un techo propio, en una hermosa realidad.
texts.en:
Nilia A. is 41 years old. She is passionate about her business selling shoes, bags and clothing. She is always ready to serve her customers with a smile, positive attitude and optimism, and she receives the best gift in exchange - they continue to buy her products. She starts her day early, just after she gets her children, ages 7 and 12, off to school. She dedicates the rest of the day to running her business. She has experimented with many products made from leather, and she now knows the best wholesalers in Bucaramanga. She orders the leather directly from them and they ship it to her. She gets the clothing from the municipality of Maicao, where they only sell during certain seasons such as December when there is demand. Nilia is very level headed when it comes to investing in her business.

She began her in 2003, when she joined the Foundation of Mario Santo Domingo. She feels very content with the communal bank, because she's not only received financing, but also good advice on making business investments. Today, she is requesting her fourth loan which she'll use to buy dresses and shoes, getting ready for a season of family parties, graduations, birthdays, weddings and other parties that often take place close to the end of the year. Her clients know they can count on Nilia to make it easy and economical to find what they need and want. Her clients are her neighbors, referrals, acquaintances, friends, and employees of the company where her brother works, who make up the majority of her business. They count on quality products, reasonable payments, and above all, friendly service. Nilia's collects accounts payable every 26 days, and she is making 18.5% profit and has debt of only 10%.

Nilia says that since her affiliation with The Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, she has improved the financial health of her business and always found good advice how to invest in and diversify her products. Her goal and greatest challenge is to have her own house, which is why she is always looking for ways to generate more income to add to her husband's salary, so that they can realize their dream to provide a good home and quality of life for their children.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling shoes, bags and clothing.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Lahore, Pakistan’s second largest city known for its history and culture. She lives with her family in the area of Shibli in a 2-room brick house. She is a seamstress and supports her family financially by doing sewing for her neighboring clients. She is good at her art and receives good orders every month.

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband who runs a PCO (Public Call Office where people make calls and are charged based on minutes of use). He has rented a small shop in his area from which he offers his clients both landline and mobile phone calls. He also sells calling cards from his shop. With the help of this loan, Sakina's husband will buy another phone set and calling cards to further expand his business. By having another phone set in the shop, he will be able to provide services to many customers at a time.

loans.use: to buy a phone set and calling cards

loans.name: Geovin Andres

texts.es:
Geovin de 27 años, es carnicero en un mercado. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 3 años  en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

La mama de Geovin le enseño como atender el negocio de carnes y como comprarla a un bajo costo pero cuando ella se enfermo tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio de carnes para poder mantener a su mama. En la actualidad ya tiene 8 años con el puesto de carnes en el mercado, trabaja solo desde muy temprano cuando comprar la carne hasta que cierran el mercado la libra de carne la vende a $ 2.5, la libra de hueso a $ 1.00. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para tener un negocio muy grande de carnes pero para ello debe trabajar y tener capital por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo carnes y un congelador. En los próximos 5 años el quiere tener  un carro para poder transporta la carne con más facilidad.
texts.en: Geovin is 27 years old and works as a butcher in the market.  He lives with his wife and two children ages 9 and 3, in an urban area called Orquideas, which means Orchids.  The town was named for the discovery of its many orchids and you'll find a park full of the flowers there.   Geovin's mother taught him about the business and how to buy meat at the best prices.  When she became ill, Geovin took charge of the business.   He's been running the small butcher's shop for 8 years, working on his own from very early morning when he buys the meat, until the end of the day when the market closes.  Geovin aspires to grow his business into a large shop.  For that he not only needs to continue working hard, but also needs capital to invest.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, as well as a freezer.  In the next 5 years, he would like to be able to purchase a car so that he can transport the meat more easily.

loans.use: To purchase meat and a freezer to help grow his butcher business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi B., age 52, started her furniture making business in 1998. She supports her family by working eight hours a day and seven days a week at her business. Laxmi and her husband have four grown children, ages 25, 27, 29, and 31.

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

Laxmi has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used it to purchase wood and timber for her work. In the future, Laxmi plans to raise the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.     

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates on the BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy wood for use in her furniture making business

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma S., age 51, opened a small hotel business five years ago. In her hotel, she prepares and sells Newar food. This is a popular food item in Kathmandu Valley because the majority of the people in this area are Newars. She is seeking a loan to buy necessary foodstuffs for the preparation of these meals, such as grains and vegetables, in order to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to improve her family's standard of living as well as to provide for a better education for her daughter and granddaughter. 

Mrs. S. lives in Tangal, near the famous market, Mangar Bazaar, in the Lalitpur district of Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this area are engaged in traditional work. She has eight members in her family, including herself. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Gopal, is a retired government officer. Her older son works in a travel agency and her younger son works in a shop. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her granddaughter is enrolled in primary school..

loans.use: To buy grains, vegetables, and other foodstuffs necessary to prepare the Newar meals she serves to her customers

loans.name: Denis Edgardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Denis Z. se dedica al comercio y su principal actividad es la venta de verduras, negocio con el cual cuenta con un año de haberlo iniciado.
Don Denis compra las verduras en la ciudad de Danlí los días lunes y jueves y los demás días de la semana los utiliza para salir a vender su producto de manera ambulante en la aldea de Jutiapa, aldeas y comunidades circunvecinas a la misma,  distribuye su producto en un bicicleta de carga que se compro con las ganancias que le a generado su negocio.
Don Denis también vende verduras en su casa de habitación pero su mayor volumen de venta lo tiene de la venta  ambulante,  se a sabido ganar la clientela por el buen producto y por los precios que vende sus verduras.
Don Denis esta casado y junto a su esposa se dedican al negocio ya que cuando él anda vendiendo su esposa atiende a los clientes en su casa.
Del matrimonio han procreado tres hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara par la compra de mas verduras para tener mayores ventas y con los ingresos que le genere su negocio cubrir con todos los gastos dentro del hogar.
texts.en: Dennis Z. has been selling vegetables from his small cart for the last year.   He buys the vegetables in the city of Danli on Mondays and Thursdays, and on the other days of the week he sells them in the town of Jutiapa and the surrounding communities.  He uses a bicycle cart which he purchased with the money he earned from his business.   Mr. Z. also sells vegetables from his house, but most of his sales are done from the cart.  He knows that he earns his customers with the quality and fair prices of his produce.   Mr. Z. is married and he and his wife both work together.  While he is out selling from the cart, his wife helps the customers who buy from their home.   They have 3 children together who depend on them.   This loan will be used to buy more vegetables to increase his sales, and generate the money they need to cover their household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, green chilies, tomatoes, garlic and yuca.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her fabric-selling business. She has had this business for many years. She receives orders from her neighbors and serves them by offering fabrics of their choice. She buys fabric from the Azam cloth market, which is a famous market in the city of Lahore. She also imports fabric from Faisalabad, which is famous for its textile industry. 

With the loan, she will buy a larger variety of fabric in bulk which will cut her unit costs. This will help her to attract more clients and make more sales. 
She is hopeful that with this loan, her business will grow and she will be able to increase her household income. 

In addition to her business, Nazia is also a very good housewife. She manages her home very well. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in Shibli town. It is located in Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second largest city and known for its history and culture.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Iv Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Unidas IV se conformo en noviembre del 2007, y durante este periodo han pasado diversas circunstancias positivas y negativas, que han podido superar y mejorar como parte de un proceso de crecimiento del comité.
 Las señoras son de la ciudad Obligado, distante a 40 km., de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven. 

Las señoras comentan que están conformes con el crédito recibido ya que les es de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con sus actividades, si bien dicen que no es fácil la vida, se muestran luchadoras y fuertes ante los desafíos que se les presenta.
 
Renuevan por 11va vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, donde la directora general.
 Ramona M. las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus responsabilidades.
La señora Ramona se dedica a la venta de ropas desde que se integró al comité y comente que le va muy bien.
Ella recurre a varias técnicas de venta, ya que expone sus ropas en su salón y también recorre en casa de conocidos, negocios, o empresas para ofrecer sus prendas. 
Comenta que llega la temporada de mucha venta por lo que quiere contar con suficiente mercaderías para sus clientes por lo que solicita el préstamo para la compra de vestidos, shorts, blusas, remeras, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas IV” (United Women IV) committee was formed in November 2007 and since then its members have experienced positive and negative circumstances which they have been able to overcome and improve as part of the committe's growth process.

The ladies are from the town of Obligado which is 40km away from Fundación Paraguaya's office.  They use their money for a number of different business activities which they carry out in the district in which they live.

They comment that they are happy with the loan which they have received since it is very helpful for them in succeeding in their activities.  They say that life is not easy but they are showing themselves to be fighters and showing strength when faced with challenges.

They are renewing their loan for the 11th time.  They are moving on to their next loan cycle owing to the excellent way in which they have paid their previous loan installments.  Their managing director Ramona M. motivates them to be punctual and to fulfil their responsibilities.  Ramona has had a business selling clothes since she joined the committee and she says that it is going very well.

Ramona has a number of techniques which she employs to sell her clothes since she displays them in her living room and also travels to acquaintances' homes, businesses or companies to offer her garments.

She comments that the approaching season sees a lot of sales so she would like to make sure she has enough merchandise for her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts and other garments.

loans.use: To buy dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts and other garments

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with one son. She and her family live in Melitopol. Marina runs a small business selling warm, colorful blankets. Presently, Marina has about 50,000 Grivnas in inventory; her net profit is about 5,000 Grivnas each month. 

Marina has been in this trade for twelve years. During this time, Marina’s business has proven to be competitive. Marina has been successful because of her hard work and persistence. Recently Marina helped her son to start a similar business.  

Marina would like to receive a loan of 15,000 Grivnas to increase her assortment of merchandise so that she can provide more items and better service to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Alain

texts.fr:
La vente des tissus  au marché est son commerce, il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de la place qui vendent des rouleaux de tissus en gros : le prêt passé a été bénéfique, il reçu beaucoup plus dans sa façon de gérer ses affaires.

Il avait renforcé son commerce avec le prêt passé, avec l’actuel  il veut  diversifier les types de tissus en misant plus sur  les tissus des uniformes scolaires.
Ses revenus ont connus aussi  une nette amélioration, de 50000f par jour, il est à 75000f  jour.
Pour ses enfants , il s’arrange avec son gagne pain de les nourrir, les vêtir et les soutenir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
His business is selling fabric at the market. He gets his supplies at the neighboring markets where they sell bolts of fabric wholesale. His previous loan was beneficial, he received much more with this new way of managing his activity.

He strengthened his business with his previous loan, with the current one he wants to diversify the kind of fabric he sells by betting on fabric for school uniforms.

His income has seen a clear improvement from 50,000 francs to 75,000 francs a day. He manages, with his livelihood, to feed, clothe, and provide for the schooling fees of his children.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of linen, virgin wool, quilted cotton and satin

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan lives in Lahore, which is the second largest city in Pakistan and famous for its food and culture. She lives in Yadgar in a two-room brick house with her family. 

She supports her family financially by sewing. She has been doing this since before her marriage and is very skilled. Due to her high quality of work, she receives regular orders. She keeps herself up-to-date about the latest fashion and trends in clothing and can sew every kind of clothing. 

Her husband is a blacksmith. He makes iron rods on order to generate income for the family. He has a God-given talent, and has nourished this skill since his childhood. He can also repair different spare parts. Due to his high quality work, many spare parts dealers approach him to make the spare parts they need.  

Rasoolan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s blacksmith business. With the loan, he will buy iron to make iron rods in larger quantities to complete orders on time. Rasoolan is hopeful that her husband will make good use of the loan and will be able to grow his business.

loans.use: To buy iron to make iron rods.

loans.name: Gilma Rubenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Gilma R. tiene más de un año de dedicarse al comercio y su principal actividad es la venta de abarrotería, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de “Belem” además de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotaría también se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos.
Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y aqui no tiene competencia cerca de su negocio.
Su negocio luce surtido y los clientes encuentran en el mismo lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Arroz, Jabones, Manteca, refrescos, huevos, café, espaguetis, carnes, lácteos, etc…
Doña Gilma vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la Agricultura ya que esta zona es la de mas producción por estar ubicado en el valle de jamastran que en años anteriores se le llamo el granero de Centro América.
Del matrimonio han procreado tres hijos dos de ellos están cursando sus estudios primarios y una bebe que esta al cuidado de la sra. Gilma.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y asi tener mayores ventas, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs Gilma R. has been in business for more than one year and her main activity is selling groceries.  Her business operates under the name “Belem”.  As well as selling groceries, she also sells new clothes and shoes.  Her business is located in her home and she doesn't have any competition nearby.

Her business is well stocked and her customers find what they most need every day such as sugar, rice, soap, butter, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, spaghetti, meat, dairy products, etc...

Doña Gilma lives with her common-law husband who is a farmer since the district in which they live is the most productive in the country as it is located in Jamastran valley which used to be called the granary of Central America.

They have three children from their marriage.  Two of them are in elementary school and the other is a baby who Gilma cares for.

Gilma will use her loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business.  She will thereby have better sales and the profits she needs to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy deodorants, soap, shampoo, conditioners, thread, sanitary towels, toothpaste, toothbrushes, candles, hairpins, hairbands, zips, soups, sugar, rice, butter, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, spaghetti, meat and dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benito Ricardo

texts.es:
