Este es el segundo financiamiento otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior  realizo compras de materia prima y  algunos activos para el negocio, su ingresó mejoró ligeramente, ya que pudo hacer una  oferta diversa a sus clientes y lograr mejores ventas que antes, cuando aun no tenia financiamiento. Con su actual credikiva logrará un mejoramiento locativo, cambiando los pisos y la pintura, con el fin de cualificar su imagen, ya que es más agradable para la clientela comer en un lugar que se vea como nuevo y muy higiénico, como el que proyecta mejorar Nury Elena.  Su sueño y gran desafío es comprar su  casa,  para lo cual esta realizando un ahorro en una empresa estatal y con ello también espera abrir otro punto en su propia nueva residencia.
texts.en:
Nury Elena F. is a 41 year old woman who lives in the city of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. She lives with her 2 children, aged 18 and 20. She has a Chinese food restaurant, a business she began after working for more than 10 years in restaurants, including Chinese restaurants, and learning how to cook. From this, the idea was born to start her own business focusing on Oriental food. Thus the Restaurante Mr. Shing Express was started. She has spent 3 years preparing recipes such as fried rice, sweet and sour pork, shrimp fried rice, chicken with noodles and rice, fish and many delicacies of Oriental cuisine. At this time she has the following financial indexes: profit margin 39.1%,  total debt 12.59%, autonomous 87.41%, the debt with the new loan is 41.67%, the inventory turnover is 5 days and the sales profit is 16.04%.

This is the second loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the previous one, she bought materials and some assets for the business. Her income improved slightly, since she was able to offer different things to her customers and have better sales than before, when she didn't have financing.  With this Kiva loan, she will be able to have improvements on her locale, changing the floors and painting. This will improve her image, since it is nicer for the customers to eat in a place that looks new and sanitary, as Nury Elena is planning. Her dream and challenge is to buy her house, for which she has been saving in a state agency and with it she also hopes to open another locale in her own residence.

loans.use: For locale improvement, changing the floors and painting her Chinese restaurant.

loans.name: Felix Bernardo

texts.es:
Felix de 44 años, es vendedor de plásticos. Vive con su esposa e hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Inicio su negocio de venta de plásticos con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado, comprando vasos, tarrinas, cucharas al por mayor pudo distribuirlas y tener unas ventas beneficiosas. Con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposa a podido mantener el negocio de plásticos. Su trabajo lo realiza recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil en su triciclo con vasos, platos, cucharas, tarrinas de plástico desde las 05h30am hasta las 14h00pm. 

Para seguir con sus ventas y tener un mayor capital el quiere comprar con el préstamo vasos, platos, cucharas plásticas para distribuirlas al por mayor. En el futuro quiere abrir un mercado de distribución de plásticos.
texts.en:
Felix is 44 years old and sells plastic goods. He lives with his wife and children in an urban area called “Orquideas” [Orchids]. The area has this name because orchids are plentiful.

He started his business selling plastic goods with a small capital he had saved. He bought cups, spoons and dishes wholesale thus being able to make a profit. He has kept his business with his wife’s help and hard work. He travels through the streets of Guayaquil on his mobile-bike offering cups, dishes, spoons and the like from 5:30AM until 14:00PM.

To be able to continue his sales and to increase his capital, he would use the loan to buy cups, dishes, spoons to distribute them wholesale. He would like to have his own stand in an open market in the future.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, plates and other goods

loans.name: Carlos Ruben

texts.es: El Señor Carlos  es soltero vive en la ciudad de el alto en Villa Juliana calle  vive  con su abuelita, su actividad económica es la venta de chamarras  coreanas juveniles que vende el las ferias también viaja  a Oruro, desaguadero y al mismo tiempo es chofer propietario de  un taxi que trabaja por las tardes  el desembolso realizado lo utilizo en el mantenimiento y reparación de su taxi  para luego realizar la venta de la movilidad y  comprar otra, el Joven Carlos es querido por su buen carácter,  puntual con sus cuotas muestra responsabilidad con sus actividades, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carlos is single and lives in the city of El Alto with his grandmother.  His business is selling Korean jackets for children.  He sells these in the markets and also travels to Oruro to sell.  At the same time, he is also the owner-driver of a taxi which he works in the afternoons.  He used his loan to have some maintenance and repair work done on his taxi so that he could then sell it and buy another.  Young Carlos is well loved for his good character.  He is also punctual with his repayments and shows a lot of responsibility in his business activities.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 39-year-old businesswoman. She operates a "one touch" printing services business in Kiambu, Kenya. She has been running this business for two years and employs two people. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy paper, printing ink and cardboard. Jane is also married and a mother of two children, who go to school. She describes herself as hard working.

loans.use: To buy paper, printing ink and cardboard

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora  Maritza vive en la zona de Alto Lima el es de familia humilde tiene dos hijos pequeños su esposo trabaja en el área técnica independientemente. La señora pertenece al banco de emprendimiento Santiago Querido, el crédito desembolsado lo destino al aumento de capital ella vende colchas y camas en las puertas de los locales de fiestas como ser matrimonios, graduaciones, bautizos y otros, también utilizo parte de ello a una refacción de su casita en un muro,  muy responsable  con sus obligaciones cuenta con mejores expectativas para poder lograr mejorar condiciones de vida a futuro
texts.en: Maritza lives in Alto Lima district.  She is from a humble family.  She has two small children and her husband works in a technical field independently.  Maritza belongs to the “Santiago Querido” communal bank.  The loan she received  was used to increase her working capital.  She sells quilts and bed sets in the doorways of buildings which host events such as weddings, graduations, baptisms, etc.  She also used part of the money to refurbish one of the front walls of her house.  Maritza is very responsible in her obligations and has better prospects for improving her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To increase working capital and infrastructure

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a las Señora Digna Rosa L. quien vive en el barrio San Miguel, de  la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrando al Comité.

 Las integrantes del comité en paralelo al trabajo que realizan en sus hogares se dedican a otras actividades como ser el comercio, que con el apoyo que le ofreció La Fundación lograron acrecentar sus ingresos, y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Ellas a través de este apoyo pudieron comprar artículos para la venta como bijouterie, medias, ropa interior, remeras, blusas, camisetas, etc. 
Manifiestan que están felices de poder integrar este grupo y poder de esa forma mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia. 
Asi la señora Digna L. quien se dedica a la venta de confecciones de ao po´i(artesania) que fabrican muchas de las señoras integrantes del comité.
Ella los adquiere a crédito y luego de vender le pagas a sus amigas y así se ayudan con las ventas. 
Son prendas de buenísima calidad y especial para la época de verano por que para esta temporada quiere estar prepara para sus clientes con suficientes mercaderías, para ello solicita el préstamo y de esa manera comprar como: camisas, vestidos, sabanas y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was established by Mrs Digna Rosa L. who lives in San Miguel neighborhood, in the city of Villarrica.  The group's members were delighted to form part of the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women).

The committee members, in parallel with the work that they carry out in their own homes, perform business activities such as buying and selling goods.  With the support offered to them by Fundación Paraguaya they have managed to increase their profits and thereby improve their quality of life.

The committee members, as a result of this support, have been able to buy articles to sell such as costume jewelry, tights, underwear, t-shirts, blouses and jerseys.

They state that they are happy to be able to form part of this group and, in this way, improve their standard of living and that of their families.

Mrs Digna L. sells clothes made from ao po'i (a fine cotton cloth which is traditional in this part of Paraguay).  Many of the other ladies in her committee make these clothes.

Digna acquires the clothes on credit and then, after she sells them, she pays her friends and they thereby help each other with the sales.  They are very good quality garments and special for the summer season.  She would like to be prepared for her customers this coming season and have enough merchandise.  For this reason, she is requesting this loan and hopes to use it to buy shirts, dresses, sheets and other products.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shirts, dresses, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia lives in a small city in the Punjab province of Pakistan, called Khanewal. She shares a two-room brick house in the Christian Colony area with her husband and five children. She shifted here after her marriage. 
Her husband's name is J. N., and he has a bicycle repair business. His shop is located in the market and he has a good number of clients who prefer his services because of the quality of his work.  
Aasia (who is holding the loan book in the photo) supports her family by doing sewing at her home. She receives regular orders from her neighborhood clients, and produces quality work. She is also a housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  
Three of her five children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. The other two are too young for school.  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repairing tools to offer better quality services to his clients. 
Aasia is hopeful that after investing the loan, her husband’s business will grow further and his income will be increased.  
This is her second loan application to Asasah. During the period of the previous loan, she always paid her instalments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy latest repairing tools for bicycle repairing business

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la  Señora Maria Paula P. de Talavera quien vive en la cuidad de  Itape. 
 Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité  Primavera.

 Las integrantes del comité se dedican en su mayoría a la artesanía, otras a la venta de comidas, enfermera y costurera, cada una con su actividad quieren lograr acrecentar sus ingresos, y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de la integrantes es la señora Maria P. quien se dedica a la Artesanía fabricando ropas, manteles, sabanas, y o accesorios para decoración.
La producción de artesanía de estas señoras son muy admiradas por los cliente ya las terminaciones son muy buenas y alta calidad, y así logran vender a importante negocios del país.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos especialmente las telas que son utilizadas para la fabricación de los ao po´i, que también es fabricada manualmente con hilos de algodón.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Maria Paula P. de Talavera who lives in the town of Itape.  The women were delighted to form a part of the 'Comité de Mujeres Rurales' (Committee of Rural Women) and named their committee 'Primavera' (Spring).

Most of the committee members make handicrafts.  Others sell food, one works as a nurse and another as a dressmaker.  Each one carries out their own business activity and together they would like to increase their profits and, thereby, improve their quality of life.

One of the group's members is Mrs Maria P. who is in the handicraft business.  She makes clothes, tablecloths, sheets and decorative accessories.

The handicrafts which these ladies produce are very much admired by their customers since they are very well finished and of high quality.  They manage to sell their products to important businesses in the country.

Maria P. is requesting this loan to buy supplies, especially fabrics which are used in creating ao po'i (a traditional Paraguayan material which is itself hand made from cotton threads).

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making ao po'i

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a 41-year-old-single mother of one. She operates a mobile accessories business. She sells mobile phone airtime and SIM cards at both wholesale and retail. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase mobile phone SIM cards and air time for sale. Her business customers, she says, are reliable and dependable in a competitive business environment. She hopes to own a home and educate her son to university level. She describes herself as focused.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone SIM cards and airtime

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Joven Alfredo G. de 26 años de edad, es soltero, cuenta con una peluqueria, realiza corte para damas, caballeros y niños, Anexo depilaciones en general,  Manicura y Pedicura.
Alfredo se acerco a la Fundación y solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de una motocicleta que le va a ayudar a ir y venir de su domicilio a su peluquería, además de hacer cortes a domicilio.
       Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya ya Kiva por la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo ya que le ayudara que vaya progresando día a día.
texts.en:
Alfredo G. is 26 years old, single, and he owns a barbershop.  He cuts hair for men, women, and children, and offers general hair removal, along with manicures and peticures.

Alfredo aproached the Foundation for a loan to purchase a motorcycle.  This will help him get to and from work, as well as allow him to offer haircuts in his customers homes.

Alfredo is greatful to both the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the loan which will help him improve things one day at a time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín se dedica a la carpintería, en algunas ocasiones trabaja con contratos grandes que le toman tres a seis meses terminarlos como fabricación de muebles empotrados, marcos de ventanas, puertas, etc. En edificios y hoteles. También trabaja en casas particulares barnizando puertas y ventanas. Don Agustín vive con sus tres hijos en una zona alejada de la ciudad de La Paz, con mucho esfuerzo él y su esposa compraron un terreno donde construyeron su domicilio, ahora se encuentra trabajando en la fabricación de marcos de ventanas hechas de madera cedro, en un futuro don Agustín desea tener todo el equipo necesario porque por el momento alquila parte de la maquinaria con la cual trabaja, de esta manera tener más ingresos y dar un futuro mejor a sus tres hijos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos y el pago a la mano de obra para dar mayor comodidad a su familia construyendo más cuartos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Agustín is a carpenter.  Sometimes he works on big contracts that take three to six months to complete like making built in units, window and door frames, etc. in buildings and hotels.  He also works in private homes varnishing doors and windows.  He is currently working making cedar window frames.

Agustín lives with his three children in an area that’s a distance away from the city of La Paz; he and his wife bought a piece of property with much effort where they built their house.  

Because he currently leases some of the machinery he works with, Agustín wants to eventually own all the necessary equipment so that his income will improve thus providing a better future for his three children.

He is asking for funds to buy bricks and to pay labor costs to build more rooms onto his house thus providing more comfort for his family.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Amapolas De Puente Group

texts.es: Esta fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes de la Sra.  Ma Guadalupe García, es la tesorera del grupo Amapolas de Puente que está ubicado en la comunidad de Puente de Ixtla en el estado de Morelos en México, en la foto se ve la mercancía que ella ofrece a sus clientes , ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes negocio que inicio hace 14 años, solicita su préstamo para surtir de mercancía su tienda, va a comprar productos lácteos que le hacen falta en su tienda, sus clientes la prefieren porque es una persona de confianza y tiene los mejores precios de la colonia, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque va a poder ofrecer productos lácteos a sus clientes,  tiene 50  años, estudió el primer año de la carrera de contador público, es soltera tiene un hijo varón de 12 años, quiere este crédito para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Mrs. Ma. Guadalupe García’s grocery store.  She is the Treasurer of the Amapolas de Puente (Puente Poppies) group located in the community of Puente de Ixtla in Morelos state, México.  In the photo one can see the merchandise she offers her customers.

She has sold groceries for 14 years and is asking for funds to stock the store.  She will buy dairy products that she needs for the store.  Her customers prefer her because she is a trustworthy person and she has the best prices in the neighborhood.  At present she feels happy because she is going to be able to stock dairy products for her customers.

She is 50 years old, finished the first year of Accounting, is single and has a 12-year-old son.  She wants the loan to buy merchandise in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has applied for a loan to expand her clothing sales business. She purchases clothes from Multan, which is famous for its embroidered clothes, and sells them to her neighborhood clients. She started this business four years ago and is hopeful that an additional investment will grow her business further, making her more income than before. 
Her husband is a poorly paid government employee. She has three children: two sons and a daughter. Her two elder children are getting their education while the youngest one has not started attending school yet. 
She lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Civil Lines. She shifted here after her marriage to A. M. 13 years ago. 
This will be her third loan with Asasah. Previously, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Hugo Filibeto

texts.es:
Hugo de 40 años, es vendedor informal de ropa. Vive con su esposa e hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

El trabajaba como guardia pero como el sueldo no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia decidió comenzar a trabajar como comerciante informal. Poco a poco su trabajo fue incrementando y las ganancias fueron creciendo así que decidió continuar con esa actividad de vendedor informal de ropa y zapatos. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano con la ayuda de su esposa. Los pantalones los vende a $ 25.00, los zapatos a $ 30.00 y las blusas a $ 5.00 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y productos de belleza para venderle a sus clientas. En el futuro quiere seguir incrementando su mercadería y tener otra línea de venta como joyería.
texts.en:
Hugo, 40, is an informal clothing merchant.  He lives with his wife and children in an urban zone, called Orquídeas, because when it was discovered there were many flowers there and currently there’s a park with these flowers.

He used to work as a Security Guard but his salary wasn’t enough to support his family so he decided to become an informal merchant.  Gradually his work grew and profits did too so he decided to continue with this informal clothing and shoes sales activity.  He currently works from very early in the morning with his wife’s help.  He sells pants for $25.00, shoes for $30.00 and blouses for $5.00 each.

He will use the loan to buy clothes and beauty products to sell to his customers.  In the future he’d like to continue to add to his stock and include an additional line of products to sell, like jewelry.

loans.use: For clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 38 and married with two children. He has a business offering rent collection and printing services. His business, Jonrho Agency Company, is located in a busy area and he employs one person. He serves clients of all income levels in his business. He hopes to own a home in Nairobi in future and grow his business into a big agency company. He describes himself as hard working and optimistic. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a computer.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Farrah's Group

texts.en:
Farrah lives in Khanewal which is a small city of Pakistan. She lives in a 2 roomed brick house with her family in the area named Christian colony. She moved here 4 years ago after her marriage to S. M.. Farrah is 27 years of age and has 3 children: 2 daughters and a son. All of the children are very young and are not yet of school going age. Farrah wants her children to get a quality education once they become older. She shares the financial burden with her husband by doing sewing works. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. Her husband is a government employee, earning a meager income. 

Farrah has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will use the loan towards buying a new sewing machine because the old sewing machine doesn’t produce quality, neat work. The new machine will help her complete her work more quickly and she will be able to make more income. She started doing this business 4 years ago and is hopeful that an investment will increase her household income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farrah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Soraya

texts.es: La Sra.  Soraya, se dedica a la Venta de peluches desde ya hace bastante tiempo y con el apoyo de sus esposo Don Edson han venido trabajando de forma conjunta para el crecimiento de la actividad que emprenden en Zonas tales como la Villa y Cumavi, de esta forma es que ellos han seguido adelante, ya que cuentan con un pequeño niño al cual quieren brindarle un mejor futuro. Actualmente ellos se ven en la necesidad de comprar un motor nuevo para su vehículo, el cual fue adquirido con mucho sacrificio y trabajo, ya que este no solo es utilizado para el transporte de su mercadería sino también como transporte urbano. La  señora es cliente antigua de la institución y ha demostrado ser excelente cliente, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Soraya has sold stuffed toys for a long time with her husband, Edson’s, help.  They have been working together towards the business’ growth which they undertake in areas like Villa and Cumavi.  This is how they have continued to get ahead.  They have a small son that they want to provide with a better future.

They bought their vehicle with much sacrifice and work.  They now need to buy a new engine for it because it’s not only used to transport their merchandise but also as urban transport.

Soraya is a longstanding client of the institution and has shown herself to be an excellent client. She is grateful to Emprender for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her vehicle.

loans.name: Rosa Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa de 60 años, vende y distribuye almuerzos todos los días. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Hace 10 años atrás comenzó a vender comida a sus vecinos para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos y poder construir su casa ya que no está casada. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora la venta de comida a sido su actividad económica para mantener a su familia. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 12h00 haciendo y repartiendo comida a sus clientes. También tiene un grupo de personas que le envía almuerzos a sus trabajos. Cada almuerzo viene con sopa, segundo (platos fuete) y jugo el valor esa $ 1.60. 

Para hacer sus comidas en un corto tiempo en la mañana ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una cocina industrial. En el futuro quiere tener otro piso en su departamento y tener más espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old, and she sells and delivers lunches every day.  She lives in an urban area known as Orchids (Orquídeas), because upon discovery, they saw many flowers, and at present there is a park of these flowers.

Ten years ago she started to sell meals to her neighbors, in order to support her four children, and to build her house, since she is not married.  From that time to date, sale of food has been the financial means to support her family.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 preparing and delivering food to her customers.  She also has a group of people who are sent lunches to their places of employment.  A lunch comes with soup, main dish, and juice; the cost is $1.60.

In order to prepare her meals in less time in the morning, she would like to use the loan to buy an industrial stove.  In the future, she wants to have another floor in her house, and more space for her business.

loans.use: Industrial stove

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra. Esperanza R. tiene 66 años de edad, vive en el Barrio los Jasminez en la comunidad de Trojes el Paraiso, Esperanza se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan casero, su especialidad es la torta de queso, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Esperanza es muy famosa por el pan que elabora ya que tiene un muy buen sabor, los años de experiencia hacen que su pan sea cada vez mejor, tiene muchos clientes fijos todos los meses.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion ahi tiene los hornos de barro en donde hace todo su producto.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de los ricos panes. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza R. is 66 years old, and lives in the Jasmines Section, in the Trojes el Paraíso community.  Esperanza’s business is making and selling home-made bread, and her specialty is cheesecake.  She has been doing this for many years, and is famous for the bread she makes, which has excellent flavor.  With her years of experience, her bread has constantly improved, and each month she has many regular customers.  Her business is located in her home, which is where she has the clay ovens where she produces the bread.
She will use the loan to buy additional materials to make her tasty breads.  She needs the earnings to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, yeast, soda, egss, butter, margarine, sugar, flavoring, cheese

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Jesús  viene trabajando desde ya hace bastantes años en el rubro del transporte urbano, actualmente el cuenta con su propio vehículo y desarrolla esta actividad diariamente, Don Jesús es soltero sin embargo tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad el cual esta a su cargo y por el cual trabaja día a día, y es justamente eso lo que empezó a preocuparle ya que su vehículo necesita de ciertas reparaciones y se le hace urgente arreglar su vehículo por este motivo solicito el crédito, ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y el trabajo normalmente se le duplica. Don Jesús se acerco a la institución por recomendación de su hermana y al haber cumplido plenamente con las exigencias de la institución se le otorgó dicho crédito ya que cuenta con un buen historial financiero y además de ello cuenta con domicilio conocido en el Barrio Roca del 6to Anillo, de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jesús has been working for many years now in the urban transportation field.  He currently has his own vehicle and he carries out his business activity every day.  Jesús is single but he has a 7 year-old son in his care, for whom he works every day.  This is why he has started to become worried since his vehicle needs certain repairs and the need to fix his vehicle has become really urgent.  This is why he is requesting this loan.  The end-of-year festive season is approaching and at that time his work normally doubles.

Jesús approached our organization on the recommendation of his sister and, as he has fully fulfilled the demands of our organization, we have awarded him this loan since he has a good financial record and has a known residence in Roca neighborhood in zone 6 of the city.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Amazonas Del Sur Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Amazonas del Sur, y se ubica en el Estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por su rio de nombre Amacuzac que en la  temporada de lluvia se vuelve muy caudaloso y que abastece una importante presa para la comunidad porque permite tener 2 cosechas durante el año. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. María Yesenia J. P. es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de queso, negocio que inicio hace 5 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la elaboración del queso, va a comprar sal, blanqueador, cuajo, ingredientes indispensables en la elaboración. Ella tiene 23 años, estudio hasta el 3er  año del bachillerato, es soltera y no tiene hijos, sus clientes están a gusto porque sus quesos tienen muy buen sabor además de que es una persona amable con ellos, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque va a aumentar su producción de queso , quiere este crédito para hacer más grande su negocio, con las ganancias espera comprar carne para volver abrir su carnicería, ya que anteriormente estudiaba y por falta de tiempo tuvo que cerrar
texts.en:
This group is called ‘Amazonas del Sur’. They are located in the state of Morelos in Mexico. The community is known for the Amacuzac river, which becomes plentiful in the rainy season and is an important resevoir for the community because it allows them to have two harvests a year. 

The group is made up of 10 members, one of whom is María Yesenia J. P.. She began her business making cheese five years ago. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase essential ingredients like salt, whitener and rennet to make cheese.

María is 23 years old, has completed three years of high school, is single and has no children. Her customers are happy with her because her cheese is very tasty, and she treats her customers with kindness. María is happy requesting this loan because it will increase her cheese production, and she hopes that this will in turn expand her business. With her earnings she hopes to purchase enough meat to re-open her butcher’s shop. Previously, she was studying, and she did not have enough time for it and had to close it down.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan A. de 56 años de edad es panadero, su cónyuge es la señora Alba Irala, tienen dos hijos varones adolescentes, estudiantes Universitarios, la familia cuenta con una pequeña micro industria familiar, se dedican a la producción de panificados, galleta criolla, palitos, coquitos, pan Felipe y otros, se dedican a este rubro hace mas de 10 años, con mucho esfuerzo están saliendo adelante y por sobre todo pudiendo costear los gastos que acarrea la educación Universitaria de sus hijos.
Solicita préstamo a  Fundación Paraguaya para la compra en cantidad de  materia prima para la elaboración de los productos ya que aumento bastante su venta y no desea fallar con su clientela.  
El Señor Juan agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo brindado y gracias a ello va a poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos y por ende su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Juan A. is 56-years-old. He's a baker. His wife is Alba Irala and they have two teenage children who are studying in the university. The family runs a small bakery where they make baked goods, cookies, pastries, bread, and other products. They've been in this line of work for more than 10 years. With a lot of hard work they're coming out ahead and earning money to finance their sons' university education. He's requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya for the purchase of raw ingredients to be used in baking. His sales have increased and he doesn't want to disappoint his customers. Juan would like to thank Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support. Thanks to this loan he's going to be able to continue increasing his profits and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of flour in bulk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and a father to one. He has been in business for two years selling clothes, suitcases and sweaters, among other products. His clients are mainly middle income earners. He is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes, suitcases and sweaters for sale in his business. He is determined to make it in business, though a beginner. He has learned effective business management through Faulu Kenya trainings.

loans.use: To buy clothes, suitcases and sweaters for sale.

loans.name: Perpesuah

texts.en: Perpesuah is 42 years and single. She is a mother to two children. She operates a tailoring business in a busy Nairobi market. She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to add stock of fabric. She hopes to grow her business to a level that she will be buying fabric in bulk and become a fabric supplier. She has been in the business for ten years and she describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric.

loans.name: Teofila Severina

texts.es: La Sra. Teófila se dedica a la compra y venta de reciclados de todo tipo como ser: papel, plástico duro, plásticos, aluminio, cobre, nylon, cartón, etc. su familia esta integrada por cinco personas tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, su esposo Agustín trabaja como transportista y ella con el reciclado ambos trabajan bastante arduamente para el sustento de la familia, el  crédito que esta solicitando lo quiere para la compra de Cartón ya que tiene un pedido que tiene que entregar la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en: Teófila buys and sells all sorts of recycling such as paper, hard plastic, plastics, aluminum, copper, nylon, cardboard, etc.  Her family has fie members.  She has three school-age children and her husband Agustín works as a taxi driver.  Both work quite hard to support their family.  The loan which she is requesting is to buy cardboard since she has an order which she would like to deliver.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy used cardboard and paper

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Khanewal which is a small city in Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a 2 room brick house in the area named Jameeabad. She moved here 11 years ago. She is a housewife and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household chores. On a part-time basis she also sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is a mother of 4 sons and 2 daughters. Three of her children are getting their education while her eldest son drives a rickshaw. 

Nasreen is married to H. N. who runs a cosmetics shop in the market. He sells different makeup products to his customers. Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing nusiness. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because she has decided to continue her business full-time now. Her old machine isn't suitable for full-time basis. She is hopeful that, with the new machine, she will be able to earn more income and contribute financially to her family in a better way. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Ines Amparo

texts.es:
Ines de 33 años, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposo y su hijo de 12 años en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 
 
Ella hace años atrás comenzó a buscar una actividad económica para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. En busca de una actividad económica ella vio que la venta de víveres era rentable y podía pasar tiempo con su hijo. Con unos ahorros compro arroz, azúcar, bebidas y readecuo la parte delantera de su casa para la venta su tienda. En la actualidad ella tiene una pequeña tienda surtida, vende arroz, aceites, bebidas, lácteos etc. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz por quintal, aceites, bebidas para su tienda y así poderla surtir. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y poder así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Ines is 33 years old.  She has a small grocery store in the front of her home.  She lives with her husband and her 12 year-old son in an urban area called Orquídeas (Orchids).   The area is so called because when it was discovered they found many flowers there and currently it has a park of orchids.

Years ago Ines began to look for a business activity to help her husband with their family expenses.  In search of an activity, she saw that the sale of groceries was profitable and meant that she could spend time with her son.  She used her savings to buy rice, sugar and drinks and she remodelled the front of her home to incorporate her store.  She currently has a small stocked store.  She sells rice, oil, drinks, dairy products, etc.  She works from 6.30am to 10.00pm every day.

She would like to use her loan to buy 100kg sacks of rice, oil and drinks to stock her store.  In the future she would like to expand her business and thereby be able to guarantee her family's future.

loans.use: To buy rice, drinks and oil

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Osvaldo casado de 55 años de edad presta servicio de trasporte de carro tirado por caballo, conocido  en la ciudad como Carumbe, todos los días se traslada a su puesto de trabajo ubicado en la esquina del Hospital mas concurrido de la ciudad donde acuden familias de mas escasos recursos económicos, el costo de su servicio es accesible para los mismos, el es padre de 5 hijos todos adolescentes, su cónyuge vende asaditos en el mismo puesto y sus hijos la mayoría ya trabajan.
      Desea seguir ayudando a su familia con esta actividad  por lo cual necesita poner en condiciones su viejo carro, nuevas ruedas, pintura arreglo de asiento y otros, motivo por el cual se acerco a Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar dicho crédito que destinara para el mismo y así seguir prestando su servicio para los mas necesitados de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is 55 years old and married.  He provides a transport service in a horse-drawn cart which is known in the city as 'carumbé'.  Every day he goes to his place of work which is on the corner of the street where the busiest hospital in the city is located and where families who have the least economic means come.  The cost of his service is affordable for these families.  He is a father of 5 children who are all teenagers.  His wife sells roasted meat in the same spot and most of his children already work.

Osvaldo would like to continue helping his family with his business which means that he needs to fix up his old cart with new wheels and a paint job.  He also needs to fix its seat and do some other work.  This is why he has approached Fundación Paraguaya to request this loan which he will use for this work and thereby be able to continue providing his service to the most needy people in the city.

loans.use: To provide maintenance for his cart

loans.name: Francisco I Madero Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Francisco I Madero porque así se llama la calle donde se reúne el grupo, está ubicado en el estado de Morelos en México, el grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.Cristina E. R. es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 37 años, estudio hasta el 3er año de secundaria, es serigrafista, tiene en total 3 hijos: una mujer y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a la serigrafía negocio que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar  plástico para hacer bolsas, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y es cuando más trabajo tiene, al momento de solicitar el crédito se siente contenta porque tendrá material para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Quiere este préstamo para surtir de mercancía su negocio, uno de sus proyectos para el siguiente año es comprarse una camioneta para distribuir su mercancía ya que por el momento pide prestado un vehículo para trasportar sus artículos
texts.en: This group is called Francisco I Madero as this is the name of the street where the group meets, it is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico, the group is made up of 9 members.Cristina E. R. is the treasurer of the group, she is 37 years old, she studied up to the 3rd year of middle school, she is a screenprinter, she has 3 children: one girl and 2 boys.  She has a screenprinting business which she began 4 years ago, she is requesting the loan to buy plastic to make bags, as it is nearing the Christmas season and this is when she has the most work, at this time of requesting the loan she is feeling happy because she will have material to complete the orders of her customers. She wants this loan to supply her business with stock, one of her projects for next year is to buy a van to distribute her stock as at the moment she has to borrow a vehicle to transport her goods.

loans.use: To buy material to make screenprinted bags.

loans.name: Alicia De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Alicia de Jesus M. tiene 61 años de edad, vive en el barrio los Jasminez de la comunidad de Trojes El Paraiso. Alicia se dedica a la fabricacion de dulces, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. tiene muchos clientes que le compran su producto. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de dulce de rapadura, este dulce se pone escaso y cuesta comprar y a veces se pone mas caro de lo normal por eso es que desea tener guardado para no quedarse sin materia prima.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs Alicia de Jesus M. is 61 years old.  She lives in the Los Jasminez neighborhood in the community of Trojes El Paraíso.  Alicia makes sweets.  She has been in this business for several years and has many customers who buy her products.  She will use her loan to buy 'dulce de rapadura' (a sweet product made from sugar cane juice).  This product is becoming scarce and costs a lot to buy.  Sometimes it is more expensive than normal which is why she would like to have some put to one side so that she doesn't end up without raw material.

The profits from Alicia's business are needed to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy 'dulce de rapadura'

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis Enrique tiene 29 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de triciclo. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Luis recibió la ayuda de su Mama que le facilito el dinero para que el lograra comprar el triciclo pues tenía que buscar la manera de mantener a su familia, Desde entonces todas las mañanas, verifica las condiciones en que se encuentra su triciclo antes de que salga a trabajar, para evitar algún tipo de inconveniente mientras es conducido. En adelante, desea comprarse otro triciclo para que pueda alquilarlo y generar más ingresos. Con el crédito que solicita, es para realizarle mejoras a su triciclo.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique, 29, provides three-wheel vehicle transport services.  He has had this business for over 4 years.  His mother helped him out originally providing money to buy the vehicle because he needed to find a way to support his family.

Since then he checks on his vehicle’s condition every morning before going out to work to avoid any inconvenience while driving.  

In the future he’d like to buy a second vehicle that he can lease out as a second source of income.

He will use the requested loan to make improvements on his vehicle.

loans.use: For repairs on his three-wheel vehicle.

loans.name: Selva

texts.es:
La señora Selva de 55 años de edad es comerciante, casada con el señor Silvio de 58 años de edad  docente jubilado, tienen un hijo varón estudiante de  Radiología. La  señora Selva  cuenta con local  comercial donde venden todo tipo de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, como remeras, pantalones, blusas para damas, lencerías y otros. Empezó gracias a la inversión realizada de parte del señor Silvio quien cuenta con buen salario.  Con mucho esfuerzo salieron adelante, ahora cuentan con un negocio prospero.
Solicita  a Fundación Paraguaya ayuda crediticia para la compra de más prendas de temporada como ser remeras, short, pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos, etc.
La Sra. Selva agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo brindado porque gracias a eso ella podrá seguir dando a sus clientes prendas de buena calidad y al mejor precio, y de esa forma mejorar cada día su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Selva, 55, is a merchant.  She’s married to Silvio, 58, who is a retired teacher.  They have a son studying Radiology.

Selva has a locale where she sells all kinds of clothes for women, men and children like: t-shirts, pants, women’s blouses, lingerie and others.  She started thanks to an investment by her husband who earns a good salary.  With much effort they got ahead and now have a prosperous business.

She is asking Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to buy more seasonal clothing like: t-shirts, shorts, pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

Selva thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help provided because thanks to it she’s been able to continue to provide good quality items at the best price to her customers thus daily improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shorts, infant wear, etc.

loans.name: Yhovana

texts.es: La Sra. Yhovana vive en la zona del Plan 3000 en el Barrio Suarez, hace 3 años que viven allí en alquiler, ellos se dedican  la confección de gorras, cuentan con máquinas industriales y rectas,  trabajan a pedido de serigrafías muy reconocidas en la ciudad. Ellos tienen una hija de 3 añitos que cuidan mientras están en casa confeccionando las gorras,  es la segunda oportunidad que ellos acceden a un crédito en Emprender ya que esta vez necesitan el dinero para invertir en materiales para la confección de las gorras como ser: telas, entretelas, botones, scrach, viceras e hilos, además de invertir también en un puesto en el mercado de la zona que les servirá para vender directamente sus gorras sin tener que entregar a intermediarios ya que ellos todos los días desde muy temprano están confeccionando y trabajando hasta muy tarde para entregar los pedidos que les hacen. Ellos se caracterizan por ser responsables y cumplidos, esperan poder comprar pronto un lote para poder luego construir su casa, asimismo ampliar su taller y poder contar con operarios  más máquinas.
texts.en:
Yhovana lives in Plan 3000 district in the Suarez neighborhood.  She has lived there for 3 years in a rental house.  She has a business making caps and has industrial and straight-line sewing machines.  She makes silk-screen printings to order which are very well known in the town.  She has a 3 year-old daughter who she looks after while she is in the house making caps.

This is the second time that she has taken a loan from Emprender.  On this occasion she needs money to invest in materials to make caps such as fabrics, inner linings, buttons, visors and thread.  She would also like to invest in a market stall in the area which will help her to sell her caps directly without having to deliver them to intermediaries.  She works every day from very early in the morning until very late to deliver the orders which she has.  She is a very responsible and courteous woman who hopes to soon be able to buy a lot where she can build her house.  She would also like to expand her workshop and be able to afford more machines for her workers.

loans.use: To buy supplies, fabrics and buttons

loans.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat is a very supportive lady. She is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She is married to S. who has a business of selling eggs. He purchases eggs from egg selling agencies, poultry farms etc., and sells them to different bakeries and grocery shops in the market. Eshrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy eggs in dozens quantities to fulfill orders of his clients and to increase the family income. 

Eshrat is confident that her husband, who has been doing this business for 5 years, will utilize the loan money in a positive manner and improve his business condition. She lives in Khanewal with her husband and 3 daughters in the area named Jameeabad, a housing colony of city Khanewal. She moved here 10 years ago. She is a housewife, stays at home and does her household works. Her daughters are of very young age and Eshrat plays full responsibility in raising them. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client who has never missed a single meeting and always paid her installment on time.

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah passbook) is Eshrat.

loans.use: To buy eggs for egg selling business.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio Gustavo B. de 30 años de edad, casado con la Señora Rosana Fernández, tiene 2 hijos, tienen una despensa donde venden articulos de primera necesidad anexo ferretería y bebidas en general cuenta con un local propio. Es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta.
Solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de panificados, gaseosas, jugos, arroz, harina, cable, flourescente, foco, etc. para aumentar su stock porque en esta época empieza a aumentar la demanda, tiene su clientela formada.
El Sr Silvio agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada porque gracias a eso él podrá seguir dando a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y al mejor precio, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio Gustavo Benítez, 30, is married to Mrs. Rosana Fernández and they have two children.  He has a grocery store where they sell basic needs items and beverages next door to a hardware store.  The grocery store is in its own locale.  He is a very hard working, honest person.

He asked for a loan to buy baked goods, soft drinks, juices, rice, flour, cable, fluorescent light bulbs, light bulbs, etc. to increase stock because this is the season when demand starts to increase.  He has a stable customer base.

Silvio thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity provided because thanks to it he will be able to continue to provide good quality items at the best price to his customers thereby continuing to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy flour, detergents, baked goods, soft drinks, juices, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a una pulpería, negocio que estableció en el interior de su casa, desde entonces atiende todos los días de la semana, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus familiares. Cuyas ganancias que obtiene en este negocio son regulares, es por esta razón que puede ayudar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos. Para el futuro está dispuesta ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, asimismo desea comprar un gran variedad de productos. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con fundación, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio como golosinas, refrescos, granos  básicos, detergentes entre otros.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 31, lives with her husband and two children.  She has had a grocery store for the last 7 years.  She set up the store in her home and since then has been open for business every day of the week.  Her family members help out.  The store produces regular profits that she can use to help her husband pay for the education of their children.

She wants to expand her store’s installations in the future as well as buy a large variety of products.

This is her second loan with the foundation and she is very happy to know that she can count on having financial help.  The loan she has requested will be very useful for her store’s progress.  She will use it to buy snacks, refreshments, basic grains, detergents, etc.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: America

texts.es:
America de 30 años, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas. Vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Comenzó a trabajar en el mercado llamado “batallón del suburbio” porque su ex esposo la abandono cuando ella estaba embarazada y tuvo que encontrar una actividad económica para poder mantener a su bebe. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su propio puesto de frutas con ayuda de su actual pareja con la que tiene dos hijos. En la actualidad está embarazada pero aun sigue trabajando desde las 05h00am hasta las 14h30 de lunes a viernes para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  frutas como tomatillos, papaya, uvas, frutillas para su negocio de frutas. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con mas frutas y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con existo.
texts.en:
America, age 30, has a stand where she sells fruit. She lives in an urban area called Suburbio de Guayaquil where most of the residents work as merchants.

America began working at the market called “Batallón del Suburbio” because her ex-husband abandoned her when she was pregnant and needed to be able to support her baby. With some effort over time, she established her own fruit stand with the help of her current partner with whom she has two children. America is currently pregnant, but she continues working Monday to Friday from 5am to 2:30pm so that she can give her children a better life.

With this loan America will buy fruits such as tomatillos, papayas, grapes, and strawberries for her business. In the future, she wants to increase her business with more fruits and see her children finish their existing studies.

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana se dedica desde hace cinco años al comercio de ganado ovino el cual trae desde la localidad de Morochata donde los venden por cantidad  y lo comercia en pie como también carneado en la localidad de Quillacollo, tiene dos hijos un niño de doce años y otra de ocho, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como chofer de camión, solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y para hacer la obra fina de su casita ya que esta haciendo construir con mucho sacrificio, su esposo también le ayuda en su actividad  transportando el ganado, es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
For the past five years, Sra. Juana has been selling sheep that she brings in from the town of Morochata. She sells the animals in quantity or by the piece since she also operates a slaughterhouse in the town of Quillacollo. Juana has two children, a twelve year old son and an eight year old daughter. Her husband works as a truck driver.

Juana is requesting a loan to use as operating capital and to begin the work on her house that she is building with great sacrifice. Her husband helps with her business by transporting the animals. Juana is a hardworking individual.

loans.use: Operating capital for her business & funding for the construction of her home

loans.name: Luceritos Azules Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Luceritos Azules y se ubica en el Estado de Morelos en México. Esta comunidad se  caracteriza  por sus múltiples balnearios que existen alrededor de la comunidad como el Iguazú, Real de San Nicolás, Aqua Splash, entre otros, esto por el clima caluroso que predomina la mayor parte del año. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.Rosaura P. O. es integrante del grupo, ella es estilista, negocio que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar material para su estética, va a comprar tintes, peróxidos, decolorantes que utiliza para trabajar en su estética, tiene 26 años, estudio hasta el 3er año de secundaria, es madre soltera tiene un hijo varón de 9 años, sus clientes están a gusto porque sabe hacer muy bien su trabajo y porque es muy amable, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque tendrá nuevos tintes que ofrecer a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga piensa comprar un regalo para su hijo porque se acerca la época navideña.
texts.en:
This group is called ‘Luceritos Azules’ (Bright Blue Stars), and  is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico. This community is characterized by the many spas; including Iguazú, Real de San Nicolás, and Aqua Splash, among others, that can be found in the surrounding areas. The spas exist because of the hot weather that Morelos enjoys for most of the year.

The group is made up of 9 members, one of whom is Rosaura P. O.. She is a stylist, and she began her business four years ago. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her salon, including hair dye and bleaches. She is 26 years old, has completed three years of high school and is a single mother with a 9 year old son. 

Rosaura's customers are happy with her because she does a very good job and treats them with kindness. Rosaura is happy to request this loan as she will be able to offer new hair dyes to her customers. With the earnings that she makes she hopes to buy her son a present since it is drawing closer to Christmas time.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. 

She is 45 years old, married to M. M. who works in a private company earning a monthly wage. Perveen also works to support her family. She offers her services as a midwife in her community. She has done this for many years and has vast experience in this field. 

She is a mother of two sons, both of whom work. Her elder son has a game shop. His shop attracts many children and earns him a good income every month. Her younger son also works in a private company. 

Perveen couldn’t afford to send her children to school.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her younger son start a meat-selling business. He is not satisfied with his income and wants to run his own business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in bulk and then sell the meat.
 
Perveen is hopeful that an investment will gives her son’s business a good start, and that he will be able to make a good profit from his business in the future. 
 
She is a new borrower of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, Perveen is the woman holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy chickens to start a meat-selling business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia  es una cliente que ya saco varias secuencias  en la institución y demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, es una cliente con buena actitud, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujer, la ropa que vende la cliente la trae desde Oruro y Perú a un precio bajo, la ropa que trae es de muy buena calidad, ella vende por mayor y por unidad, su puesto esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio en su casa tiene varias galerías que las va a alquilar y en alguna de ellas va a vender, ella actualmente esta separada, ella trabaja junto a sus dos hijos, sus hijos le ayudan a la venta de ropa y paralelamente estudian, ella también da trabajo a personas jóvenes que también les incentiva a que no dejen el estudio, la señora es buena y la actitud de su madre la tienen sus hijos, el destino del crédito es la compra de ropa por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is a client who has already participated in several loan cycles with Emprender and has demonstrated responsibility and promptness with her payments. She is a client with a good attitude. Patricia sells women’s clothing that she acquires from Oruro and Peru at a low price. The clothes she brings in are of very good quality and she sells them in bulk and by the unit. Her stand is located in her house where she also has several display areas that she plans to rent out while there are a few she plans to sell. Patricia is currently separated and works with her two children who help sell clothing while attending school. She also provides employment to young people and encourages them not to quit their studies.

Sra. Patricia has a good attitude when it comes to being a mother to her children. This loan will be used to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Olga Lorena

texts.es: Olga Lorena tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar fundación. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos. Ella tiene ciertos clientes muy bien establecidos ya que ha sido muy gratificante el obtener a nuevos clientes, siempre está realizando diferentes clases de platillos su experiencia la obtiene todos los días ya que obtiene cosas nuevas cada día. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, verduras, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mantener a sus clientes y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga Lorena is 49 years old and sells food. She has worked a long time with Fundación Leon 2000, so this is not the first time she has received a loan. Olga has some very well-established customers, but she is always grateful whenever she attracts new ones. She is always serving different types of dishes. Her experience is constantly on display since she is able to come up with new things each day.

The reason for this loan is to buy supplies such as basic grains, vegetables, juices, sodas, and other products. Her dream is to maintain her customer base and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, vegetables, juices, sodas, and other products

loans.name: Las Pagadoras De Jojutla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Pagadoras de Jojutla, y se ubica en centro de la comunidad de Jojutla de Juárez en el estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue porque su principal actividad económica es el cultivo de la caña de azúcar, la mayor parte de los campos están sembrados de caña. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.Concepción Arreaga Díaz es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes negocio que inicio hace 3 años, solicita su préstamo para surtir de mercancía su tienda, va a comprar productos enlatados, tiene 42 años, estudio hasta el 3er año de secundaria, es soltera tiene en total 2 hijos: una una mujer y un varón, sus clientes la prefieren por ser una persona de confianza, al momento de solicitar su préstamo se siente contenta porque sabe que entre mas surtida este su tienda mas ganancias obtendrá. Quiere este crédito para surtir de mercancía su tienda, quiere remodelar su local, para que tenga una mejor imagen  y mas  clientes la visiten,  con las ganancias espera darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Pagadoras de Jojutla (the Jojutla Payers) and is located in the Jojutla de Juárez community center in the state of Morelos in Mexico. This community is known for its primary economic activity, sugar cane cultivation. Most of the fields there are planted with sugar cane. The group is made up of 10 members. 

Concepción A. Díaz is a member of the group. She has made her living selling groceries for three years now. She is requesting the loan in order to restock her store and with it, she will buy canned goods. She is 42 years old and finished three years of high school. She is single and has two children in total: a girl and a boy. Her customers are loyal to her because she is a trustworthy person. 

She is happy now that she is requesting the loan because she knows that when her store is better stocked, she'll earn more money. She wants this loan so that she can restock her store. She wants to remodel her store so that it will look nicer and attract more customers. With her earnings she hopes to give her children a better education.

loans.use: Store investments

loans.name: Vitalino

texts.es:
El señor Vitalino O. de 39 años de edad, casado con la señora Arminda de 32 años quien es docente, el señor es chapista que aprendió dicha carrera de su padre el cual se dedico toda la vida a eso, cuenta con un tinglado grande donde hace sus trabajos de pintura , soldadura en general, retoques de abolladura y otros. Conocido en la zona por su buen trabajo posee clientela formada. 
El señor se acerco a la Fundación y solicito a poyo crediticio porque necesitaba comprar un compresor de aire, puesto que el que tenía ya no funcionaba bien y le dificultaba mucho realizar su trabajo, gracias al apoyo de  la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva pudo comprar el compresor y así seguir ofreciéndole a sus clientes servicios de excelente calidad y buen precio.
texts.en:
Sr. Vitalino O. is 39 years old and married to Sra. Arminda, age 32, who is a teacher. He works as an auto body mechanic who learned the trade from his father who dedicated his entire life to his career. Vitalino has a large shed where he performs paint jobs, general welding, alterations, and other services. He is well-known in the area for doing good work and has an established customer base.

Vitalino approached Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan because he needs to buy an air compressor since the one he currently has is not functioning well, which makes it difficult to do his job. Thanks to the support from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, he will be able to buy a compressor and continue offering his customers high quality service at a good price.

loans.use: Purchase a new air compressor

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 34 años, convive con Juan Pablo, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yaroka. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, ahí siembra desde hace 16 años los diversos cultivos oriundos de la zona como: papa, arveja, choclo y gladiolos. Los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad. Sin embargo hace algunos años que se encuentra invirtiendo en la compra de su propio terreno agrícola. “ya estoy pagando una parte, pero me falta poco, para poder terminar de cancelar”, afirma. Por ello en cada cosecha se las ingenia para poder vender su producción a muy buen precio, pues está segura que cuando concrete su compra podrá obtener más ganancias. Pero no solo a ello se dedica ella, ya que tiene chanchos, a los que después de cebarlos, comercializa su carne en el mercado central de su localidad. Elvira, es una mujer muy inteligente y con ganas de progresar, ya que eso le enseñó MFP, en sus constantes charlas educativas. Ya es el segundo crédito que tiene, con su banco comunal, y como buena integrante es puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir 20 sacos de abono; 100 sacos de guano (fertilizante natural), ya que muy pronto cosechará sus 8 hectáreas de cultivo de choclo.
texts.en:
Elvira, age 34, lives with Juan Pablo, who is 44. They have three young children who they take care of and provide an education. Elvira and her family live in their own home in the rural area of Yaroka. She has been farming for 16 years and grows different crops that are native to the area such as potatoes, peas, corn, and gladiolas. After each harvest, she sells her crops at the local central market. A few years ago, she invested in the purchase of her own farmland. “I am making small payments, but when I fall a little short, I find a way to complete them,” she says. With each harvest she manages to sell her products at a very good price, thus ensuring that she is able to generate more income. In addition to farming, she raises and fattens pigs and sells the meat at the local central market. Being an intelligent woman who wants to make progress, Elvira takes advantage of frequent educational seminars provided by MFP.

This is the second loan she has received from her Communal Bank. She has proven to be a good member by being prompt with her payments. The loan she requested will be used to buy 20 sacks of compost and 100 sacks of guano (bird manure used as a natural fertilizer). She has eight hectares of corn that will be harvested soon.

loans.use: Purchase 20 sacks of compost & 100 sacks of guano

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar se dedica desde hace cuatro años a trabajar como carpintero, pese a su edad el ya conoce muy bien acerca de la actividad de carpintería y ya realiza trabajos en contrato para personas particulares, para lo cual necesita capital para la compra de materia prima para construir puertas y ventanas, en su casa vive con su esposa y su hija de un año, el solo mantiene el hogar, es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, uno de sus deseos es el de comprarse un terreno para hacer construir su casita y tu taller de carpintería.
texts.en: Sr. Edgar has been working as a carpenter for four years.  Despite his age, he has already become very knowledgeable about the carpentry business.  His jobs are performed on contract for people he knows.  For this reason, he needs capital to buy materials for making doors and windows.  He lives at home with his wife and one year old daughter.  Edgar is the only one supporting the household.  He is a hard worker and a very responsible young man.  One of his wishes is to buy a plot of land where he can build a house and set up a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Juana Yaneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana V. es comerciante y su actividad es la venta de abarrotaría, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de “mini pulpería las Acacias” su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y cuenta con 1 año de experiencia en la administración del mismo, anteriormente la sra. Juana se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero por asuntos personales decidió cambiar de negocio.
En el tiempo que doña Juana tiene de administrar su nuevo negocio a adquirido mucha clientela por su amabilidad, la ubicación de su negocio, la variedad de producto que tiene y los precios que son un poco más bajos que los demás negocios de la zona.
Doña Juana esta casada y con su esposo concibieron tres hijos, los que en la actualidad están cursando sus estudios primarios, juntos con su esposo han logrado salir adelante con la frente en alto y ofreciendoles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana V. is a merchant who sells groceries. Her business operates under the name “Mini Pulpería Las Acacias” and is located in her home. She has one year of experience running her business. Sra. Juana previously sold clothing, but she decided to change businesses for personal reasons.

During the time Doña Juana has managed her new business, she has acquired many customers because of her kindness, the location of her business, the variety of products she offers, and the fact that her prices are slightly lower than other businesses in the area.

Doña Juana is married. She and her husband have three children who are enrolled in elementary school. Together they have been able to get ahead with the heads held high and provide a good future for their children.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelia es casada, se dedica a la venta de prendas deportivas remeras y otros atuendos, cuenta con local propio situado en el B° Loma Clavel de nuestra ciudad desde hace 10 años se dedica a esto y es reconocida en la comunidad por tener una distinguida clientela y de muy buena calidad sus prendas. Ella vive con sus dos hijos  y su esposo, tienen casa propia situada, así como medios de transporte( moto, auto) para realizar sus actividades.
Con la ayuda de a la Fundación Paraguaya espera crecer mas en su vida laboral y económica y así lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Evelia is married and sells sportswear such as jerseys and other apparel. She has her own store in the B° Loma Clavel of the city. Evelia has been in business for ten years and is recognized in the community for having a distinguished clientele and offering high quality garments. She lives with her two children and her husband in their own home. They also have their own means of transportation (a motorcycle and a car) so that they can engage in their activities.

With the help of Fundación Paraguaya, Evelia hopes to grow more in her work life and in her finances as well as achieve well-being for her family.

loans.use: Purchase sportswear & jeans

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El señor Iván dedicado al servicio de transporte de minibús  ya hace bastante tiempo realiza este trabajo rutinario  durante todo el día para así cubrir los gastos de la familia y algunas medicinas continuas que necesita su esposa, por problemas en el útero razón por la cual no cuenta con un trabajo y es dependiente total de su esposo el que necesita este crédito para la compra de llantas para su vehículo y reparación su motor, ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, es un apersona muy trabajadora su deseo es el de ver a su esposa sanita y sin ningún problema de salud.
texts.en:
Iván is a minibus driver.  He has been doing this routine job for quite some time to cover family expenses and for some medicines that his wife needs all the time due to uterine problems that prevent her from working.  She is, therefore, completely dependent on her husband.

He needs this loan to buy tires for the vehicle and to repair its engine because it’s having a few mechanical problems that prevent him doing a good job.  

He is a very hard working person and his wish is to see his wife well with no health problems.

loans.use: For engine repair and tire purchase.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio Villa Paso de la ciudad de Pilar.
Vive en casa propia, donde se refleja que poseen con todas las comodidades para un trabajador.
El mismo es comerciante, cuenta con una  empresa de servicios e ventas de comidas por deliveri, por pedido y servicios de restorant en su local propio, sobre la ruta.
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para la elaboración de hamburguesas para su negocio.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 5 años, brindando sus buenos servicios a sus clientelas.
Cliente manifiesta que con la ayuda del crédito se ha fortalecido  más su microempresa y  agradece por los buenos servicios que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
He is single and lives in the city of Pilar’s Villa Paso neighborhood.

He lives in his own house which has all the comforts a worker has.

He is a merchant.  He has a firm that provides home-delivered food on order and a restaurant in his own locale along the route.

He is asking for funds to buy ingredients to make hamburgers for his business.

He has been in this line of work for 5 years providing good customer service.

He states that help from the loan has strengthened his mini business and he expressed his gratitude for the good services that Fundación Paraguaya provides.

loans.use: To buy baked goods, vegetables and other ingredients to make hamburgers to sell.

loans.name: Benson Waweru

texts.en:
Benson is 45 years old, married to Alice. They have two children whom they support. Alice contributes to the family income. Benson has been growing rice for about five years with an income of approximately Kshs. 10,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This is his first loan from KADET--Benson intends to use it to buy supplies and hire labor for his rice farm. He has never borrowed from any other MFI. He will use the extra income for farming tomatoes and french beans as a secondary activity. He hopes to educate his children to the highest level and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and hire labor for rice farm.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia tiene 57 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de su actividad, pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar la condición económica de su hogar. Ella tiene que levantarse desde las 5 de la mañana para realizar la elaboración de sus diferentes platillos, Ana cocina muy rico y disfruta mucho de hablar con sus clientes y hacer lo que le gusta. Debido a que se acercan muy buenas fechas requiere hacer este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia, 57, sells food.  She has been in this business for over 12 years.  She is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her work because she’s always seeking ways to improve her home’s economic situation.

She has to get up at 5am every day to start making her various dishes.  Her dishes are very tasty and she enjoys chatting with her customers and preparing what they like very much.  

Because very good times are approaching she is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to make her dishes.
