He is a very enterprising man and is always looking for ways to provide his family with their daily bread since he is a responsible husband and father.  He has been in this business for more than 3 years and it has been a great help in getting his family ahead.  He has managed to increase his business activity on his own.  He is now requesting a loan so that he can buy more tanks of gas as the Christmas period is approaching and he has a number of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras”  ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y no  tiene hijos,  la señora  estudió educación secundaria (completa).

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio (venta de golosinas y útiles escolares).

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar más mercaderías para su tienda.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una tienda de abarrotes y tienda de zapatos en Arequipa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y las charlas que brinda la promotora.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 31 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She completed her secondary education.

Inés has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling candies and school writing materials.

She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 nuevos soles which she will use to buy more merchandise for her store.

Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store and a shoe store in Arequipa.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings, the punctuality and the talks which Movimiento Manuela Ramos provide.

loans.use: To buy candies and school writing materials

loans.name: Santa María Group

texts.es: Perseverancia, iniciativa y deseo D. desarrollo por salir adelante son parte D. las características primordiales D. la alcancía comunal Santa Ana, conformado por 10 integrantes en su mayoría mujeres desD. hace mas D. 1 año, este grupo viene trabajando D. forma paraje y en constante desarrollo, cada integrante en forma individual, muestra D. ello es la señora Jacinta B. D. 47 años D. edad y madre soltera D. 2 dos hijos D. los cuales uno aun es menor D. edad. Ella se levanta todas las mañanas muy temprano para abrir la bodega que tiene como fuente D. ingresos para su hogar, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones a lo largo D. 8 años que es el tiempo que tiene su bodega. La señora Jacinta B. emprenD. este negocio a raíz del abandono D. su esposo dejándola con dos menores hijos a su cuidado por tanto, necesitaba D. un sustento para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Con el reciente préstamo implementara mercadería  para la campaña naviD.ña. Como la señora Jacinta cada integrante tiene una historia en particular con buenos y malos momentos a lo largo D. sus vidas pero, si en algo coinciden es el deseo D. superación que demuestran todos los días por el bienestar D. sus familias y negocios.
texts.en:
Perseverance, initiative and a desire for development and success have been some of the main characteristics of the Santa Ana communal bank which has 10 members, most of whom are women.  For more than a year this group has been working in such a way, in constant development, every member in their own way.

One of the group's members who demonstrates these characteristics is Jacinta B. who is 47 years old and the single mother of two children, one of whom is still school age.  She gets up very early each morning to open her small grocery store which is the source of income for her household.  It has provided her with a lot of satisfaction over the 8 years for which she has owned it.  Jacinta B. started this business when her husband left her with two young children in her care.  She needed a way to earn a living in order to support her family.  With her recent loan, she will buy merchandise for the Christmas season.  Like Jacinta, every member of the group has their own story with good and bad moments throughout their lives but they all have a desire to overcome obstacles and they demonstrate this every day for the well-being of their families and their businesses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cheese, cream and curd

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 40 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 18 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy conocida en su negocio pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan para no perderlos. Siempre se caracteriza por brindar un buen servicio. Martha se levante todos los días temprano para recibir a sus clientes. Ella solicita este crédito para aprovechar la temporada navideña que ya se acerca. Sueña con establecer una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha Lorena is 40 years old and has been in the business of selling used clothes for more than 18 years.  She is well known in her business since she is alway in tune to what her clients need so she doesn't lose them.  She is always characterized for providing good service.  Martha wakes up early everyday to tend to her clients.  She is asking for a loan to take advantage of the Christmas season that is approaching.  She dreams of establishing a store from home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 23 años de edad,  tiene un hijo. Tiene grado de instrucción secundaria completa.
Verónica, está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo recibido, que fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo utilizó para  incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, estos productos son comprados desde Ilave y Desaguadero para poder  llevarlos  a Tacna. 
La señora  solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería  de su negocio.
Su sueño es  progresar en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría entre sus compañeras (socias).
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the communal bank “Brisas de Rio Blanco”, located in the district of  ubicado en el distrito of Pilcuyo, El Collao province, departament of Puno. She is 23 years old and has a son. She finished high school.  

Verónica has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. The first loan she received was for S/ 300.00 nuevo soles. She used it to increase her business' merchandise. She buys and sells cereals. She buys these products from Llave and Desaguadero to be able to take them to Tacna. 

She will ask for a new loan for S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles. This loan will allow her to increase her business' merchandise. Her dream is to progress in her business. What she likes about the communal bank is the cheerfulness with the other members.

loans.use: To buy cereals wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts (shocks, wheel springs, bearings, etc.) for taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of gold, silver, plaster, and stones for graduation rings

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: Verónica Del Socorro tiene 37 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes que buscan los diferentes productos que ofrece. Es madre soltera con un hijo de 8 años a su cargo, ella se encarga de administrarle lo necesario. El crédito que se es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, jugos y detergentes. Ella se esfuerza cada día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima pues ya se acercan muy buenas fechas.
texts.en: Verónica Del Socorro is 37, and she owns a small market. She wakes up very early to serve her clients that come looking for her products. She is a single mother with an 8-year old son. The loan will be used to buy snack food, soft drinks, juices, and detergent. She works very hard every day to provide good quality service to her clients. This loan will be used to buy supplies as there is high demand this time of year.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tres Marías es llamado así por la comunidad en donde viven y se sienten orgullosas de representar a su colonia. Está conformado por 10 mujeres emprendedoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante quienes se ubican en Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Guadalupe R. R. (Panadería), María de Lourdes Pérez Sánchez (Antojitos). Hortencia C. S. (Ropa Interior por Catalogo), María de Lourdes López Ramírez (Cosméticos por Catalogo), Juana B. Sánchez (Venta de Cobertores), María Josefina S. Ríos (Dulcería), Beatriz Ramírez P. (Materias Primas), Montserrat Rodríguez Pérez (Cosméticos por Catalogo) y Clara Martínez Martínez (Cosméticos por Catalogo).

Ella es María Magdalena M. de veintiocho años de edad es ama de casa y comerciante, tiene una hija de seis años quien estudia la primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ella comenzó con las ventas desde hace diez años, cuando se caso con su esposo ya que fue quien le enseño y ahora es un soporte muy fuerte para él, sus ventas las realiza cada tercer día en los tianguis que se encuentran cerca de su comunidad y los demás días los ocupa para surtir su mercancía como: zapatos, tenis, etc, actualmente ella va a comenzar con la fabricación de bicicletas para la temporada navideña ya que es lo que se vende bien en esta fechas. El crédito solicitado lo ocupara para la compra de llantas, frenos, pintura, etc., y tiene mucha fe en que le ira bien en sus ventas. Sus planes por el momento son poder ampliar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas para brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija y ahorrar para comprarse una casa

Tres Marías agradece el apoyo brindado que recibe de Kiva por parte de Fundación Realidad ya que esto les ayudara a cumplir sus metas
texts.en:
The Three Marias Group is named after the neighborhood where the women live, and they are proud representatives of their town. The group is made up of 10 hardworking women with a desire to improve there lives. They live in Valle de Chalco, in the state of México. The members are: Guadalupe R. R. (Bakery), María de Lourdes Pérez Sánchez (Snacks). Hortencia C. S. (Underwear sales via catalog), María de Lourdes López Ramírez (Cosmetic via catalog), Juana B. Sánchez (Blanket sales), María Josefina S. Ríos (Sweet Shop), Beatriz Ramírez P. (Raw materials), Montserrat Rodríguez Pérez (Cosmetics via catalog), and Clara Martínez Martínez (Cosmetics via catalog).

Maria Magdalena M. is 28 years old and is a housewife and saleswoman. She has a six-year old daughter who is in primary school. Maria works selling shoes; she started this job more than ten years ago when she married her husband. Her husband taught her the business and now she is a great support for him. They sell their products every three days in a market that is located near their community and the other days they stock up on merchandise such as: shoes, tennis shoes, and other products. Currently she is starting to make bicycles for the coming Christmas season because bikes sell very well at this time of year. The loan money will be used to buy tires, brakes, paint, and other materials to make the bicycles, and she is confident that sales will go well. Her plans are to grow her business and increase sales to provide a better future for her daughter and to buy a house. 

Tres Marías is thankful for the support they receive from Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad because they help them achieve their goals.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, tires, cosmetics, and candies.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: El Jardin (Flat) Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Jardín está localizado en la comunidad de Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 7 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son la señora Bibiana Hernández Hernández va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, tortillas, pan, mayonesa, chiles, jamón, carnes, queso, etc. Par elaborar sus alimentos, la señora Florentina Hernández Hernández va a comprar refrescos, dulces, pan, jamón, maíz, verduras, tortillas, para preparar su comida para sus antojitos mexicanos, la señora Marcela M. P. va a comprar azúcar, aceite, detergente, sopas, refrescos, etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora María Félix Martínez F. va a comprar algunas sabanas y colchas para surtir sus pedidos, la señora Gregoria Hernández G. va a comprar puercos vivos para matanza y vender la carne por kilo, la señora Paula Díaz M. va a comprar abono, esfoyares para la siembra, la señora Nora Díaz Mejía va a comprar telas, hilos, sierres, puntas, estambres para empezar con su negocio de taller de costura. La señora Nora Díaz Mejía es integrante del grupo El Jardín, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada su esposo es campesino, tienen 3 hijos Alejandro tiene 16 años estudia el 3er. Semestre del CECYTE, Fernanda tiene 14 años estudia el 3er. Año de secundaria y Rafael tiene 6 años estudia la primaria, ella tiene su taller de costura y solicito su préstamo para comprar telas, encajes, puntas, estambres, bies, hilos, pintura textil y va a comprar el uniforme de física de su hijo para el desfile del 20 de noviembre, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años en la costura cuando tenía 17 años aprendió por medio de las brigadas que van enseñando en los pueblos cursos de costura y hace 10 años fueron del CECATEM a dar cursos de corte y pintura ella y sus hermanas asistieron a ese curso todas sus hermanas saben corte, su máquina de coser de motor se la compro su esposo y después poco a poquito compro las pinturas y las telas su negocio está en su casa en Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan. Su negocio es importante porque puede ayudar un poco con los gastos de la casa y no le deja toda la carga a su esposo,  lo que más le gusta del negocio es cuando ve terminado su trabajo y lo ve bonito se siente estimulada a seguir haciendo las prendas y sabe que aunque es mujer puede valerse por sí misma, se siente orgullosa cuando sus hijos le dicen que le quedo bonito y que a su hija le nace la inquietud de ayudarle tiene sus servilletas que su hija va haciendo y ahorita que esta mas grande le quedan más bonitas, ella está orgullosa con su negocio porque lo que gana la saca de apuros el guardadito que puede hacer la saca de apuros, sus clientes son sus comadres, vecinas y conocidos y compañeros de sus hijos que les hace los vestidos para los bailables de la escuela como ropa de manta, sacos, pantalones, faldas de Adelita, blusas con bordados. Ahorita tiene aproximadamente como 10 clientes son pocos porque le va a ayudar a su mama en el puesto de antojitos Mexicanos hacen dobladitas, sopes y gorditas en las mañanas y los fines de semana en el mes de octubre, noviembre y diciembre es cuando hay más clientes en el puesto de su mama. su negocio enfrenta la competencia que hay más personas que se dedican a la costura pero para todos sale el sol siempre y cuando estemos trabajando y echándole ganas, con las ganancias compra algunas pinturas que se le van terminando, hilos, para alguna emergencia del hogar para doctor o para gastos de la escuela. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio sacando unos trabajos de pintura textil con dibujos de navidad y ofreciéndolos por temporada de navidad como cojines, servilletas, cortinas, manteles. Marcelino Rodríguez es un pueblo que se formo con la gente que llegaba a trabajar a la Hacienda y se quedaba ya establecida, en esta hacienda era territorio de comercio de los antepasados hay restos de vasijas y piezas antiguas. Este negocio si le ha ayudado a su familia en lo económico en lo recreativo se entretiene realizando la pintura, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son abrir una puerta que dé a la calle y remodelar un cuartito que hay para su taller de costura y pintura, sus sueños son agrandar el negocio y tener una maquina industrial, las mejoras que desea lograr para el futuro de sus hijos son ayudarles a sostenerse en sus estudios para que tengan una profesión. La señora Nora se siente feliz y comprometida con este préstamo que le proporcionan por qué se va a surtir de sus materiales para la costura y la pintura y elaborar sus cojines, servilletas y cortinas decorados con dibujos de navidad y del niño Jesús de la Virgen María y de San José. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “que estamos  agradecidas con los apoyos que recibimos y que tengan la confianza en nosotros para crecer juntos”
texts.en:
This group is called El Jardín (The Garden) and is located in the community of Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of seven female members who know each other and are neighbors. The members are Bibiana Hernández Hernández, who is planning to use her loan to purchase refreshments, tortillas, bread, mayonnaise, peppers, ham, meats, cheese, and other items to make her meals. Florentina Hernández Hernández plans to purchase refreshments, candies, bread, ham, corn, vegetables and tortillas to prepare her Mexican cuisine. Marcela M. P. plans to purchase sugar, oil, detergent, soups, refreshments and other items to stock her business. María Félix Martínez F. plans to purchase some sheets and bedspreads to fulfill her orders. Gregoria Hernández G. plans to purchase live pigs to butcher and sell meat by the kilo. Paula Díaz M. plans to purchase fertilizer for her crops. Nora Díaz Mejía plans to purchase fabrics, thread, zippers, yarn and other items for her seamstress business.
Nora is 37 years old and is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband comes from the country. They have three children: Alejandro is 16 years old and is in his third semester of college; Fernanda is 14 years old and is a junior in high school; and Rafael is 6 years old and in primary school. She has a sewing shop and is requesting the loan to purchase sewing supplies, and she also plans to buy a uniform for her son so he can march in the Nov. 20th parade. She started her business 20 years ago when she was 17 years old. She learned the craft from taking sewing courses in her village, and 10 years ago she and her sisters went to the local vocational school to take painting lessons. Now all her sisters also know how to paint. Her husband bought her a sewing machine and little by little she bought some paints and fabrics. She runs her business out of her home in Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan. Her business is important because it allows her to help a little with household expenses and doesn't put everything on her husband. What she enjoys most about her work is when she finishes a job and it comes out beautiful, and she feels stimulated to keep making her garments. She knows that although she is a woman she can stand on her own, and she feels proud when her children tell her she does beautiful work. Her daughter has always been interested in helping her, and started making handkerchiefs. Now she keeps making them bigger and prettier. Nora's customers are her friends, neighbors, acquaintances and friends of her daughter, for whom she makes dresses for the school dances. Currently she has about 10 customers. It's a small amount because she is helping her mother at her food stand making Mexican cuisine in the mornings and on the weekends during the months of October, November and December, which is the busiest time of year for her mother's business. Nora's business has competition since there are a lot of people who make a living in sewing, but there is always a way to make money. With her profits she plans to buy some paintings, thread, and save some in case there is an emergency and her family needs a doctor or cover school expenses. She is planning to expand her business, taking out some textile painting jobs with Christmas themes as well as offering Christmas-themed cushions, handkerchiefs, curtains and table cloths. Marcelino Rodríguez is a village that was formed by plantation workers, and their pottery and antiques still remain. Nora's business has helped her family financially and she is able to paint in her spare time. Her biggest desire is to make improvements to her home by building a door opening up to the street and remodeling a room for her sewing and painting shop. Her dreams are to expand her business and have an industrial sewing machine. She wishes to be able to help provide for her children's education so they can become professionals. Nora feels happy and committed to this loan because she plans to stock up on sewing and painting supplies in order to make cushions, handkerchiefs and curtains with pictures of Christmas, Baby Jesus and the Virgin Mary.
The members of this group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that "we are grateful for the support we are receiving and have confidence we will grow together."

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, lace, thread, textile paint and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: 02.08.1.11 Group

texts.en:
Hoa M. T. (60) is a 47-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hoa is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.08.1.11 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.11).

Hoa is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, Hoa owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling to local businesses and community members. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1.800.000 VND a month.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Hoa is requesting her first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, for 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Lan (61) is a 29-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  L. T. Them (62) is a 22-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  L. T. Toan (63) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  T. T. Thuy (64) is a 46-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa M. T. (60) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.08.1.11 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.11).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1.800.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Lan (61) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Them (62) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  L. T. Toan (63) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  T. T. Thuy (64) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Amormia's Group

texts.en:
Amormia A. is from the village of Bañadero, city of Ozamis. She is 35 years old, single and has one school-aged child. Amormia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Amormia A.’s Group.

To make a living, Amormia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Amormia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be the third loan taken out by Amormia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

loans.name: Susie Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Susie Fe L. is from the Barangay of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married to Sergio L. and blessed with four children. Two of her children are now working abroad and the other two are school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a Sari-sari Store and a Carenderia (restaurant) business. She is also receiving support from her husband's salary as a government employee. She’s been engaged in this kind of Sari-sari Store and Carenderia business for 13 years already. She is earning an average amount of not less than PHP 8,000 from this kind of business. 

Just this year, Susie Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susie Fe, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 as her first loan, which will be used for the financing of her agricultural activity. Any remaining amount will be used as additional capital for her existing Sari-sari store and carenderia business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia C. is from Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has two adult children.

Sofronia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sofronia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi S. lives in Tangal, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Binod S., works in a Mobil shop. Her older son is in the ninth grade and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. S. sells different types of shoes and sandals in a footpath market. The rent for the shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent.  So she is seeking a Rs30,000 loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, especially for children and women.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Sanu Maiya C. is 35 years old, and married, with 2 children aged 17 and 10.  In 2000, she established her furniture-making business.  She works 7 days a week and 8 hours a day to support her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase wood and timber for her work.  In the future, Sanu Maiya plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  http://www.kiva.org/partners/62

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

Benito joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benito is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to financially support members of his extended family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia J. lives in Proper, Brgy. Mahawak, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Food Vending ("Halo-Halo Shaved ice dessert) businesses. Her common-law husband Roland Marijuan is 47 years old and works as a dental technician to earn his living.  She has one child who is 13 years old.

 Ignacia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ignacia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future education of her child and for family needs. 

Ignacia J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of pump boat materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta C. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish vending businesses. She lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Barangay Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of approximately $300. 

Violeta is borrowing 16,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Violeta hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Kuy's Group

texts.en:
Six people form this group loan. They are located in Peam Reang Kraom village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Kuy S., a 31-year-old married woman, as the group leader. The members of this group loan hope that their families will increase their incomes to improve living conditions. 

Mrs. Kuy S. is a farmer who owns and cultivates a plot of rice field for a living. Her husband, Mr. Kaing Sokha, 40 years old, works as a Khmer cake maker. Mrs. Kuy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more Khmer cake supplies to support her husband's business. 

This couple has a child who is four years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela C. is a married woman who lives in Purok New Barbacan, Barangay Retac, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a videoke bar business. Her husband Emiliano C., who is 38 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have four children who are between 7 and 15 years old and are currently going to school. 

Fidela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fidela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $100, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more supplies for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Fidela C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Krestellyn

texts.en:
Krestellyn V. is 24-year-old single woman who supports herself by operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She lives in Purok 1, Barangay 3, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her store, she is gradually making her life more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $494. 

Krestellyn is borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Krestellyn hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum H., a 44-year-old married woman, was selected by the four group members to be the group leader. They are living in Anlong Ta Sek Kraom village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes. 

Mrs. Sum H. and her husband, Mr. Nea Ly, are farmers wH. own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice and corn for a living. They do not have enough money to support their farming. So Mrs. Sum H. would like to ask for a loan to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to cultivate rice and corn. 

They are farmers wH. work very hard to support their four children. Three of their children are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to cultivate rice and corn

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Barangay 3, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a candy-making business. Her husband Agapito M., who is 38 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have four children who are between 3 and 14 years old, and all of them are currently going to school. 

Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $150, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Mercy M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov S. is a 39 year old married woman, and she is the group leader that was selected by its four members.  They are located in Samraong K'aer village in Kandal province.  Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Pov S. is a potato seller who is able to earn a small profit to support her family.  Since her business is going well she wants to expand it.  Thus she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more potatoes to enlarge her current business.  Her husband, Mr. Khim Nhor, 41 years old, works as a construction worker.

This couple have three children:  One is a medicine seller and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to enlarge her current business.

loans.name: Sit's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of fourteen people; located in Lvea Sa Kraom village, in Kandal province.  Mrs. Sit S. is 56 years old, and she is the group leader after having been selected the village bank president by its members.  The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support his or her different purpose. 

Mrs. Sit S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow different vegetables for a living.  With vegetable farming, she faces a problem, because she does not have enough money to grow the vegetables.  So she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow it. 

Mrs. Sit S. is a widow with three children.  One is a taxi driver, and one is employed in a company and the last one is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida O. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Zenaida is widowed and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI.

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for cooking. She also wants to purchase pigs and chickens to raise. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients fo her cooked food selling

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea H., a 46-year-old married woman, is the village bank president, having been selected by its twelve members. They are living in Lvea Sa Kraom village, in Kandal province. With the loans, the members will use the money to support their different purposes.

Chea H. and her husband, Mr. Kong Rorn, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. They need assistance with this venture, so Chea H. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and oil for cultivating rice. 

This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other one is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and oil for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Nona's Group

texts.en:
Nona M. is from the village of Santa Rosa, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Nona is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nona prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $58 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nona joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Tea's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen members make up this village loan. They are located in Lvea S. Kraom village, in Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. Tea C., who is 45 years old, as the village bank president. With the loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Tea C. and her husband, Mr. Prum Doeun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Tea C. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Tea C. is also a tailor at home where she can earn a little extra income to support her family. 

This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and also help with their parent's farming activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo L. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. He is 21 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, he operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2009 Carmelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. 

Carmelo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. This will be his 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has lived in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen for over 25 years. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry. She is married to M. H. who is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw. Through the rickshaw, he provides transport services to passengers. He has been in this business for over 10 years. 

Shamim has given birth to 4 sons and a daughter. She couldn’t provide her elder children with education due to poor financial conditions. So they started doing different kinds of work in their teenage years. Her eldest son is a hairdresser by trade. The 2nd one works in a factory for a low salary and the third one is a tailor by trade.  

Now, due to her children’s work, Shamim’s financial conditions have become much better and she is able to enroll her younger children in school.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will replace his old tyres with new tyres because the old cart can't cover long distances before it gets a puncture and that is affecting his work and income. Shamim is hopeful that after investing money in his business, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In past years, she has maintained a good credit history by paying installments on time and attending every meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To replace the tyres of a rickshaw

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion B. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 42 years old. Asuncion is married and has four children. To make a living, Asuncion owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Asuncion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in her farming business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Asuncion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in farming business

loans.name: Nasipkan

texts.en:
Nasipkan B. is a 52-year-old farmer with two children. Nasipkan’s husband is also engaged in livestock breeding. During 28 years of their marriage, they have been supporting each other in all activities, which serves as the best example of a happy couple for their children.   

To find means of income for the family, in 1998, Nasipkan and her husband started to breed cattle, using their start-up capital of only 5,000 KGS. Today Nasipkan has a small farm and manages to earn about 6,000 KGS monthly by selling meat products at the local market.  

Nasipkan is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy livestock to fatten and resell. With the revenues from this investment, Nasipkan dreams of buying a house for her son.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the most vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. They are located in Lvea Sa Kraom village, in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Srey S. O., who is 55 years old, as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey S. O. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates different vegetables. With this vegetable farming, she can sell her product for a profit. Even though she can save some money, she still does not have enough money to fix her house. So she would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to repair her house. 

Mrs. Srey S. O. is a widow with a child who works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To add her savings to repair her house.

loans.name: Nasim's Group

texts.en:
Nasim is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is 48 years old but is still very active and does her work very well. She is married to M. I. who has a business selling clothes. He purchases clothes from wholesale markets of Lahore called "Ichra" & "Shahalmi” and sells to his local area clients at a profit. 

Nasim has given birth to 2 sons. Her elder son operates a thread-selling business while the younger one stays at home. He is 18 years old and illiterate. Nasim couldn’t provide education for her children due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread in bulk quantity to improve his sales. Nasim is hopeful that an investment will help her son to improve his business on a large scale and increase his income as well. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy thread for thread-selling business

loans.name: Amanat's Group

texts.en:
Amanat is 40 years old. She married A. M. and moved to Kot Radha Kishan some years ago. Kot Radha Kishan is a small city in Pakistan located in Punjab province and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there in an area called Jajwala in a three-room brick house with her family. She herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is a very supportive lady and tries her best to give comfort to her family with her work. She has given birth to 5 sons and a daughter. She couldn’t educate them due to poor financial conditions. 

Her husband works in a factory. Her 2 elder sons also work in the factory with their father and the others stay at home. Amanat’s husband wants to start a bangle-selling business because the Eid is on the way and ladies and young babies love to wear bangles to celebrate the Eid holiday. That’s why Amanat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan amount, her husband will buy bangles in large quantity to sell after his day job. 

Amanat is hopeful that starting a new business will be profitable for her husband and the loan  will become a great resource for him to start up that business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Amanat.

loans.use: To buy bangles to start up a bangle-selling business

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya has applied for a loan for the 6th time from Kiva partner Asasah. This time she has acquired a loan to financially assist her husband in his jewelry business. He is a goldsmith by profession and operates his shop in the market. He sells costume as well as gold and silver jewelry to his clients. With the loan, he will buy costume jewelry sets because gold has become very high in price and people can only afford to buy costume sets to wear.

She lives in a 3-room brick house with her family in a small city named Kot Radha Kishen which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. Her home is located in Kot Mianiayaan which is a residential area of the city. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both of them are getting their education. Her daughter is studying in 7th while her son is in the 10th class. 

She is 52 years old and is married to A. A.. A. has been in this business for more than 10 years and keeps himself updated about the latest and most fashionable jewelry designs in the market. Ruqqiya is hopeful that her husband will be able to make positive changes to his business by investing money in his business.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry sets to resell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a forty-year-old married lady with four children, living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to have all the children complete tertiary education. She owns a clothing shop and over nine years she has seen it grow tremendously, that is, from an initial capital of one million five hundred thousand shillings to three million, although there is still a challenge of limited capital. She hopes to see her business expand further. 

Amina needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter is a regular loan user of Asasah. This time she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s grocery store. He is operating his grocery shop in the market where he sells daily use items like cooking oil, salt, rice, spices, etc. He has a good number of customers who prefer to purchase groceries from his shop due to his reasonable prices. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity for his grocery store and that will help him make more sales. 

Shamim is hopeful that with the help of an investment, her son’s business will grow and she will be able to help him get married soon. She lives with her family in a small city of Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishan. Her home is in the area named Kot Mianiaan which is a small housing colony in the city. She has been living here since her marriage to S. A., 24 years ago. Her husband sells clothes while her younger son works in a factory for a low wage.  
She also has a daughter who is fifteen years old, who stays at home and manages the household chores. Shamim couldn’t provide education to her children due to financial constraints. 

In her previous five years' loan record, she has been found to be a very responsible person who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a thirty-six-year-old single mother of three children. She runs a retail shop and lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She dreams of constructing a personal permanent house and of transforming her retail shop into a wholesale shop. Paying school fees for all her children is not a simple task she says, thus the need for a loan. 

Harriet intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur M. is married and has three children. She was born into a large family of farmers and from early childhood was the main helper in the household for them. She graduated from medical college and worked as a nurse in a hospital. In 1985, she got married and soon became the mother of two daughters. Her husband worked as a bus driver but his wage was too low to cover all the expenses of the family. 

In order to find an additional means of subsistence, Aynur decided to start up a business selling fabrics at the local market.  Her responsible and accurate attitude toward this activity allowed her to put aside some savings and purchase a house for the family. 

In 2000, Aynur gave birth to her son, which became one of the happiest moments in her life. Her strong will to give children all they need, led Aynur to broaden her business and obtain her first loan from   Bai Tushum ad Partners.  With the revenues from this loan, she was able to renovate her house and buy a car for her elder daughter.  
  
Now, Aynur is applying for a loan of 125,000 Kyrgyz Soms to widen her assortment of goods.  With the revenue, she plans to open a small shop with different kinds of fabrics for all seasons.
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishan which is located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its agriculture and dairy industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area named Kot Mianiaan. She came here after her marriage many years ago. She is 52 years old married to N. D.. They  have 2 sons. Due to financial reasons she is unable to educate her children. Both sons are in their teens and don't work.  

Her husband has a business selling hair oil. He has a small shop in the market. He not only sells hair oil from his shop but also supplies different hair salons and other shops by taking orders from them. He has been doing this business for the past 8 years and is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Rasheeda herself is a housewife, stays at home and does her household works.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy hair oil in large quantity for reselling. This will help him fulfill larger orders on time and generate more sales.  Rasheeda is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position which will result in better financial conditions of her family. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has built a good credit history and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy hair oil for reselling

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en:
Shukria is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a clothes selling business from home, her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Shukria faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to and from the market where she purchase clothes for resale. She hopes to open a clothes selling stall and sell more clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a fifty-eight-year-old married man with nine children. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. Geofrey dreams of opening up a store for his farm produce and educating her children so that they can have a better future.

Geofrey wants a loan to pay labor for farmland clearing and to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Paying labor for farmland clearing and buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena C. M. de 30 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 5 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Carmen posee una venta bastante grande de diferentes tipos de productos como: sopas instantáneas, granos básicos, detergentes, verduras, shampoo en bolsitas, especias y otros más. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual desea salir adelante, es por ello que desea aumentar los productos de su negocio, el cual se encuentra en el mercado municipal de Opico, lo que es muy beneficioso para ella, debido a que es uno de los mercados más grandes del lugar, por lo que las ventas son muy buenas. Carmen solicita un préstamo con el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Carmen Elena C. M. is 30 years old. She lives in San Juan Opico with her husband and 5 year old daughter, who is in school. Carmen sells a lot of different types of products such as: basic grains, detergents, vegetables, pouches of shampoo, spices and more. She is a very hardworking woman who wants to get ahead. That is why she wants to increase her business' products. Her business in the municipal market of Opico. This is very beneficial to her, since it is one of the biggest markets in the area and her sales are very good. Carmen is asking for a loan with the wish to grow her business and in this way improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy basic neccesity products

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Joaquín Antonio

texts.es: Joaquín Antonio F. de 61 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, quien vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 10 años de edad, junto a quienes reside en San Juan Opico. Con el deseo de brindar todo lo necesario en su hogar, Joaquín posee una venta de platillos típicos como: tamales y pupusas, en el negocio le ayuda su esposa la cual se dedica a la elaboración de los alimentos, los cuales comercializan frente a la parroquia de San Juan Opico, esto es muy positivo para ellos, ya que le permite contar con más clientes, por ser una zona bastante concurrida. Tanto Joaquín como su esposa son dos personas muy responsables, las cuales desean contar con  una vida mejor para ellos y sus hijos. Es por esto que Joaquín solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para la compra de materia prima como: maíz, verduras, queso y otros más los cuales le permitan aumentar su producción, lo cual es muy importante para Joaquín ya que el bienestar de su familia es su principal objetivo.
texts.en:
Joaquín Antonio F. is 61 years old.  He is a very responsible man who lives together with his wife and two daughters, aged 11 and 10, in San Juan Opico.  With the desire to provide his household with all necessities, Joaquín owns a food stall where he sells traditional dishes such as tamales (dough steamed or boiled in a leaf wrapper and given a savory filling) and pupusas (thick corn tortillas with savory filling).  His wife helps him in his business preparing the food.

They sell their food opposite the San Juan Opico town hall.  This is very good since it provides them with more customers as it is quite a busy area.  Both Joaquín and his wife are two very responsible people who wish to provide themselves and their children with a better life.  This is why Joaquín is requesting a loan which will provide him with the necessary money to buy ingredients such as: corn, vegetables, cheese and others.  This will enable him to increase his production which is very important to Joaquín since his family's well-being is his main goal.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make traditional dishes

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Sulema

texts.es: Ana Sulema H. D.
texts.en: Ana Sulema H. D.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a clinical laboratory

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of basic material for making food.

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es: Francisca Elizabeth R. D. A. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 12, 11 y 6 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María se dedica a elaborar pupusas para vender, las cuales son el platillo más famoso D. este país, por lo que posee gran demanda, así mismo comercializa fresco D. horchata, una bebida muy típica D. esta región. María es una persona muy responsable con su familia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. mejorar sus ventas y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así mismo una vida mejor a su familia. Con el dinero María comprará: maíz, queso, frijoles, y todo lo necesario para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en: Francisca Elizabeth R. D. A. is 35 years old.  She lives in Usulután department with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and her three children, aged 12, 11 and 6, who attend school.  María makes and sells pupusas (thick corn tortillas with a savory filling).  'Pupusas' are the most famous dish of the country and for this reason she has high demand.  She also sells fresh 'horchata' which is a typical drink in this region.  María is a very responsible person as far as her family is concerned.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from Integral in order to improve her sales and proviD. her customers with a better service.  In this way she can proviD. a better life for her family.  With her money María will buy corn, cheese, beans and everything she needs to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and cheese to make 'pupusas'

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
Nicanor A. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. He is 58 years old. Nicanor is single. To make a living, Nicanor owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nicanor has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when he sells his raised animal.

In 2010, Nicanor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicanor is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nicanor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishen which is located in Punjabi, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture and dairy industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family. She moved here 15 years ago.  She is 44 years old, married to M. N. and a mother of 4 daughters. Allah Rakhi is aware of the importance of education but unfortunately, she couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints.

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from animal markets on cheaper rates, raises them up and sells them to butchers. He has been doing this business for over 10 years and it is working well for him. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young animals and improves his   sales. Allah Rakhi is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and help him to improve the financial condition of his family. 

Allah is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit rating and never missed ameeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: To buy animals for an animal sales business

loans.name: José Adalberto

texts.es: José Adalberto J. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive únicamente junto a su esposa. Desde hace más de 10 años que José posee su propia disco móvil, con la cual durante años a prestado sus servicios, amenizando fiestas. Así mismo trabaja junto a su esposa criando camarones los cuales posteriormente comercializa con diferentes clientes fijos. De esta manera José se gana la vida, con todo el deseo de contar con una estabilidad económica aceptable. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar diferentes tipos de iluminación, maquinas para hacer humo, cables, y todo lo necesario para poder realizar un mejor trabajo y de esta manera contar con más trabajo lo cual es lo principal para José.
texts.en: José Adalberto J. is 35 years old.  He lives in Usultán department with his wife.  José has owned his own mobile disco for more than 10 years and has provided his service for years, livening up parties.  He also works together with his wife raising prawns which he then sells to different regular customers.  In this way José earns his living, with every desire to achieve an acceptable level of economic stability.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy different types of lighting, smoke machines, cables and everything he needs to be able to better carry out  his work and thereby gain more work which is the most important thing for José.

loans.use: To by new lighting for his mobile disco

loans.name: Ever Arnoldo

texts.es: Ever Arnoldo G. U. de 33 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy responsable, el cual se esfuerza a diario por contar con una vida mejor para él y sus hijos. Ever vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, y el menor de 10 meses de vida. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, trabajo en el cual trabaja desde hace 5 años atrás por lo que cuenta con clientes ya establecidos, así mismo con el fin de contar otra fuente más de ingresos también se dedica a hacer viajes en su pick up, transportando diferentes tipos de objetos pesados. Ever solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con la capacidad económica de comprar más madera, y de esa forma mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Ever Arnoldo G. U. is 33 years old.  He is a very responsible father who works hard every day to create a better life for himself and his children.  Ever lives with his wife and three children aged 6, 4 and 10 months.  He buys and sells wood, a business he has been in for 5 years.  He already has established customers.  In order to have an additional source of income, he also makes trips in his pick up truck, transporting different kinds of heavy objects.  Ever is requesting a loan so that he can buy more wood and in this way improve his business.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.en:
Telesforo G. Sr. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 54 years old. Telesforo is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Telesforo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Telesforo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Telesforo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Telesforo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. Telesforo is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure.
